content: 1 On the first day of the second month, in the second year following the exodus from the land of Egypt, the LORD spoke to Moses in the wilderness of Sinai, in the Tent of Meeting, saying:
content_old: 1 On the first day of the second month, in the second year following the exodus from the land of Egypt, the LORD spoke to Moses in the wilderness of Sinai, in the Tent of Meeting, saying:

content: 2 Take a census of the whole Israelite community by the clans of its ancestral houses, listing the names, every male, head by head.
content_old: 2 Take a census of the whole Israelite community by the clans of its ancestral houses, listing the names, every male, head by head.

content: 3 You and Aaron shall record them by their groups, from the age of twenty years up, all those in Israel who are able to bear arms.
content_old: 3 You and Aaron shall record them by their groups, from the age of twenty years up, all those in Israel who are able to bear arms.

content: 4 Associated with you shall be a man from each tribe, each one the head of his ancestral house.
content_old: 4 Associated with you shall be a man from each tribe, each one the head of his ancestral house.

content: 5 These are the names of the men who shall assist you: From Reuben, Elizur son of Shedeur.

content_old: 9 From Zebulun, Eliab son of Helon.

content: 10 From the sons of Joseph: from Ephraim, Elishama son of Ammihud; from Manasseh, Gamaliel son of Pedahzur.
content_old: 10 From the sons of Joseph: from Ephraim, Elishama son of Ammihud; from Manasseh, Gamaliel son of Pedahzur.

content: 48 For the LORD had spoken to Moses, saying:

content: 50 You shall put the Levites in charge of the Tabernacle of the Pact, all its furnishings, and everything that pertains to it: they shall carry the Tabernacle and all its furnishings, and they shall tend it; and they shall camp around the Tabernacle.
content_old: 50 You shall put the Levites in charge of the Tabernacle of the Pact, all its furnishings, and everything that pertains to it: they shall carry the Tabernacle and all its furnishings, and they shall tend it; and they shall camp around the Tabernacle.

content: 51 When the Tabernacle is to set out, the Levites shall take it down, and when the Tabernacle is to be pitched, the Levites shall set it up; any outsider who encroaches shall be put to death.
content_old: 51 When the Tabernacle is to set out, the Levites shall take it down, and when the Tabernacle is to be pitched, the Levites shall set it up; any outsider who encroaches shall be put to death.

content_old: 52 The Israelites shall encamp troop by troop, each man with his division and each under his standard.

content: 53 The Levites, however, shall camp around the Tabernacle of the Pact, that wrath may not strike the Israelite community; the Levites shall stand guard around the Tabernacle of the Pact.

content: 1 This is the line of Aaron and Moses at the time that the LORD spoke with Moses on Mount Sinai.
content_old: 1 This is the line of Aaron and Moses at the time that the LORD spoke with Moses on Mount Sinai.

content: 2 These were the names of Aaron’s sons: Nadab, the first-born, and Abihu, Eleazar and Ithamar;
content_old: 2 These were the names of Aaron’s sons: Nadab, the first-born, and Abihu, Eleazar and Ithamar;

content: 3 those were the names of Aaron’s sons, the anointed priests who were ordained for priesthood.
content_old: 3 those were the names of Aaron’s sons, the anointed priests who were ordained for priesthood.

content: 4 But Nadab and Abihu died by the will of the LORD, when they offered alien fire before the LORD in the wilderness of Sinai; and they left no sons. So it was Eleazar and Ithamar who served as priests in the lifetime of their father Aaron.
content_old: 4 But Nadab and Abihu died by the will of the LORD, when they offered alien fire before the LORD in the wilderness of Sinai; and they left no sons. So it was Eleazar and Ithamar who served as priests in the lifetime of their father Aaron.

content: 5 The LORD spoke to Moses, saying:
content_old: 5 The LORD spoke to Moses, saying:

content: 6 Advance the tribe of Levi and place them in attendance upon Aaron the priest to serve him.
content_old: 6 Advance the tribe of Levi and place them in attendance upon Aaron the priest to serve him.

content: 7 They shall perform duties for him and for the whole community before the Tent of Meeting, doing the work of the Tabernacle.
content_old: 7 They shall perform duties for him and for the whole community before the Tent of Meeting, doing the work of the Tabernacle.

content: 8 They shall take charge of all the furnishings of the Tent of Meeting—a duty on behalf of the Israelites—doing the work of the Tabernacle.
content_old: 8 They shall take charge of all the furnishings of the Tent of Meeting—a duty on behalf of the Israelites—doing the work of the Tabernacle.

content: 9 You shall assign the Levites to Aaron and to his sons: they are formally assigned to him from among the Israelites.
content_old: 9 You shall assign the Levites to Aaron and to his sons: they are formally assigned to him from among the Israelites.

content: 10 You shall make Aaron and his sons responsible for observing their priestly duties; and any outsider who encroaches shall be put to death.
content_old: 10 You shall make Aaron and his sons responsible for observing their priestly duties; and any outsider who encroaches shall be put to death.

content: 11 The LORD spoke to Moses, saying:
content_old: 11 The LORD spoke to Moses, saying:

content: 12 I hereby take the Levites from among the Israelites in place of all the first-born, the first issue of the womb among the Israelites: the Levites shall be Mine.
content_old: 12 I hereby take the Levites from among the Israelites in place of all the first-born, the first issue of the womb among the Israelites: the Levites shall be Mine.

content: 13 For every first-born is Mine: at the time that I smote every first-born in the land of Egypt, I consecrated every first-born in Israel, man and beast, to Myself, to be Mine, the LORD’s.
content_old: 13 For every first-born is Mine: at the time that I smote every first-born in the land of Egypt, I consecrated every first-born in Israel, man and beast, to Myself, to be Mine, the LORD’s.

content_old: 42 So Moses recorded all the first-born among the Israelites, as the LORD had commanded him.

content: 43 All the first-born males as listed by name, recorded from the age of one month up, came to 22,273.
content_old: 43 All the first-born males as listed by name, recorded from the age of one month up, came to 22,273.

content: 44 The LORD spoke to Moses, saying:
content_old: 44 The LORD spoke to Moses, saying:

content: 45 Take the Levites in place of all the first-born among the Israelite people, and the cattle of the Levites in place of their cattle; and the Levites shall be Mine, the LORD’s.
content_old: 45 Take the Levites in place of all the first-born among the Israelite people, and the cattle of the Levites in place of their cattle; and the Levites shall be Mine, the LORD’s.

content: 46 And as the redemption price of the 273 Israelite first-born over and above the number of the Levites,
content_old: 46 And as the redemption price of the 273 Israelite first-born over and above the number of the Levites,

content: 47 take five shekels per head—take this by the sanctuary weight, twenty gerahs to the shekel—
content_old: 47 take five shekels per head—take this by the sanctuary weight, twenty gerahs to the shekel—

content: 48 and give the money to Aaron and his sons as the redemption price for those who are in excess.
content_old: 48 and give the money to Aaron and his sons as the redemption price for those who are in excess.

content: 49 So Moses took the redemption money from those over and above the ones redeemed by the Levites;
content_old: 49 So Moses took the redemption money from those over and above the ones redeemed by the Levites;

content: 50 he took the money from the first-born of the Israelites, 1,365 sanctuary shekels.
content_old: 50 he took the money from the first-born of the Israelites, 1,365 sanctuary shekels.

content: 1 The LORD spoke to Moses and Aaron, saying:
content_old: 1 The LORD spoke to Moses and Aaron, saying:

content: 2 Take a separate census of the Kohathites among the Levites, by the clans of their ancestral house,
content_old: 2 Take a separate census of the Kohathites among the Levites, by the clans of their ancestral house,

content: 3 from the age of thirty years up to the age of fifty, all who are subject to service, to perform tasks for the Tent of Meeting.
content_old: 3 from the age of thirty years up to the age of fifty, all who are subject to service, to perform tasks for the Tent of Meeting.

content: 4 This is the responsibility of the Kohathites in the Tent of Meeting: the most sacred objects.
content_old: 4 This is the responsibility of the Kohathites in the Tent of Meeting: the most sacred objects.

content: 5 At the breaking of camp, Aaron and his sons shall go in and take down the screening curtain and cover the Ark of the Pact with it.
content_old: 5 At the breaking of camp, Aaron and his sons shall go in and take down the screening curtain and cover the Ark of the Pact with it.

content: 6 They shall lay a covering of dolphin skin over it and spread a cloth of pure blue on top; and they shall put its poles in place.
content_old: 6 They shall lay a covering of dolphin skin over it and spread a cloth of pure blue on top; and they shall put its poles in place.

content: 7 Over the table of display they shall spread a blue cloth; they shall place upon it the bowls, the ladles, the jars, and the libation jugs; and the regular bread shall rest upon it.
content_old: 7 Over the table of display they shall spread a blue cloth; they shall place upon it the bowls, the ladles, the jars, and the libation jugs; and the regular bread shall rest upon it.

content: 8 They shall spread over these a crimson cloth which they shall cover with a covering of dolphin skin; and they shall put the poles in place.
content_old: 8 They shall spread over these a crimson cloth which they shall cover with a covering of dolphin skin; and they shall put the poles in place.

content: 9 Then they shall take a blue cloth and cover the lampstand for lighting, with its lamps, its tongs, and its fire pans, as well as all the oil vessels that are used in its service.
content_old: 9 Then they shall take a blue cloth and cover the lampstand for lighting, with its lamps, its tongs, and its fire pans, as well as all the oil vessels that are used in its service.

content: 10 They shall put it and all its furnishings into a covering of dolphin skin, which they shall then place on a carrying frame.
content_old: 10 They shall put it and all its furnishings into a covering of dolphin skin, which they shall then place on a carrying frame.

content: 11 Next they shall spread a blue cloth over the altar of gold and cover it with a covering of dolphin skin; and they shall put its poles in place.
content_old: 11 Next they shall spread a blue cloth over the altar of gold and cover it with a covering of dolphin skin; and they shall put its poles in place.

content: 12 They shall take all the service vessels with which the service in the sanctuary is performed, put them into a blue cloth and cover them with a covering of dolphin skin, which they shall then place on a carrying frame.
content_old: 12 They shall take all the service vessels with which the service in the sanctuary is performed, put them into a blue cloth and cover them with a covering of dolphin skin, which they shall then place on a carrying frame.

content: 13 They shall remove the ashes from the altar and spread a purple cloth over it.
content_old: 13 They shall remove the ashes from the altar and spread a purple cloth over it.

content: 14 Upon it they shall place all the vessels that are used in its service: the fire pans, the flesh hooks, the scrapers, and the basins—all the vessels of the altar—and over it they shall spread a covering of dolphin skin; and they shall put its poles in place.
content_old: 14 Upon it they shall place all the vessels that are used in its service: the fire pans, the flesh hooks, the scrapers, and the basins—all the vessels of the altar—and over it they shall spread a covering of dolphin skin; and they shall put its poles in place.

content: 15 When Aaron and his sons have finished covering the sacred objects and all the furnishings of the sacred objects at the breaking of camp, only then shall the Kohathites come and lift them, so that they do not come in contact with the sacred objects and die. These things in the Tent of Meeting shall be the porterage of the Kohathites.
content_old: 15 When Aaron and his sons have finished covering the sacred objects and all the furnishings of the sacred objects at the breaking of camp, only then shall the Kohathites come and lift them, so that they do not come in contact with the sacred objects and die. These things in the Tent of Meeting shall be the porterage of the Kohathites.

content: 16 Responsibility shall rest with Eleazar son of Aaron the priest for the lighting oil, the aromatic incense, the regular meal offering, and the anointing oil—responsibility for the whole Tabernacle and for everything consecrated that is in it or in its vessels.
content_old: 16 Responsibility shall rest with Eleazar son of Aaron the priest for the lighting oil, the aromatic incense, the regular meal offering, and the anointing oil—responsibility for the whole Tabernacle and for everything consecrated that is in it or in its vessels.

content: 17 The LORD spoke to Moses and Aaron, saying:
content_old: 17 The LORD spoke to Moses and Aaron, saying:

content: 18 Do not let the group of Kohathite clans be cut off from the Levites.
content_old: 18 Do not let the group of Kohathite clans be cut off from the Levites.

content: 19 Do this with them, that they may live and not die when they approach the most sacred objects: let Aaron and his sons go in and assign each of them to his duties and to his porterage.
content_old: 19 Do this with them, that they may live and not die when they approach the most sacred objects: let Aaron and his sons go in and assign each of them to his duties and to his porterage.

content: 20 But let not the Kohathites go inside and witness the dismantling of the sanctuary, lest they die.
content_old: 20 But let not the Kohathites go inside and witness the dismantling of the sanctuary, lest they die.

content: 21 The LORD spoke to Moses:
content_old: 21 The LORD spoke to Moses:

content: 22 Take a census of the Gershonites also, by their ancestral house and by their clans.
content_old: 22 Take a census of the Gershonites also, by their ancestral house and by their clans.

content: 23 Record them from the age of thirty years up to the age of fifty, all who are subject to service in the performance of tasks for the Tent of Meeting.
content_old: 23 Record them from the age of thirty years up to the age of fifty, all who are subject to service in the performance of tasks for the Tent of Meeting.

content: 24 These are the duties of the Gershonite clans as to labor and porterage:
content_old: 24 These are the duties of the Gershonite clans as to labor and porterage:

content: 25 they shall carry the cloths of the Tabernacle, the Tent of Meeting with its covering, the covering of dolphin skin that is on top of it, and the screen for the entrance of the Tent of Meeting;
content_old: 25 they shall carry the cloths of the Tabernacle, the Tent of Meeting with its covering, the covering of dolphin skin that is on top of it, and the screen for the entrance of the Tent of Meeting;

content: 26 the hangings of the enclosure, the screen at the entrance of the gate of the enclosure that surrounds the Tabernacle, the cords thereof, and the altar, and all their service equipment and all their accessories; and they shall perform the service.
content_old: 26 the hangings of the enclosure, the screen at the entrance of the gate of the enclosure that surrounds the Tabernacle, the cords thereof, and the altar, and all their service equipment and all their accessories; and they shall perform the service.

content: 27 All the duties of the Gershonites, all their porterage and all their service, shall be performed on orders from Aaron and his sons; you shall make them responsible for attending to all their porterage.
content_old: 27 All the duties of the Gershonites, all their porterage and all their service, shall be performed on orders from Aaron and his sons; you shall make them responsible for attending to all their porterage.

content: 28 Those are the duties of the Gershonite clans for the Tent of Meeting; they shall attend to them under the direction of Ithamar son of Aaron the priest.
content_old: 28 Those are the duties of the Gershonite clans for the Tent of Meeting; they shall attend to them under the direction of Ithamar son of Aaron the priest.

content: 29 As for the Merarites, you shall record them by the clans of their ancestral house;
content_old: 29 As for the Merarites, you shall record them by the clans of their ancestral house;

content: 30 you shall record them from the age of thirty years up to the age of fifty, all who are subject to service in the performance of the duties for the Tent of Meeting.
content_old: 30 you shall record them from the age of thirty years up to the age of fifty, all who are subject to service in the performance of the duties for the Tent of Meeting.

content: 31 These are their porterage tasks in connection with their various duties for the Tent of Meeting: the planks, the bars, the posts, and the sockets of the Tabernacle;
content_old: 31 These are their porterage tasks in connection with their various duties for the Tent of Meeting: the planks, the bars, the posts, and the sockets of the Tabernacle;

content: 32 the posts around the enclosure and their sockets, pegs, and cords—all these furnishings and their service: you shall list by name the objects that are their porterage tasks.
content_old: 32 the posts around the enclosure and their sockets, pegs, and cords—all these furnishings and their service: you shall list by name the objects that are their porterage tasks.

content: 33 Those are the duties of the Merarite clans, pertaining to their various duties in the Tent of Meeting under the direction of Ithamar son of Aaron the priest.
content_old: 33 Those are the duties of the Merarite clans, pertaining to their various duties in the Tent of Meeting under the direction of Ithamar son of Aaron the priest.

content: 34 So Moses, Aaron, and the chieftains of the community recorded the Kohathites by the clans of their ancestral house,
content_old: 34 So Moses, Aaron, and the chieftains of the community recorded the Kohathites by the clans of their ancestral house,

content: 35 from the age of thirty years up to the age of fifty, all who were subject to service for work relating to the Tent of Meeting.
content_old: 35 from the age of thirty years up to the age of fifty, all who were subject to service for work relating to the Tent of Meeting.

content: 36 Those recorded by their clans came to 2,750.
content_old: 36 Those recorded by their clans came to 2,750.

content: 37 That was the enrollment of the Kohathite clans, all those who performed duties relating to the Tent of Meeting, whom Moses and Aaron recorded at the command of the LORD through Moses.
content_old: 37 That was the enrollment of the Kohathite clans, all those who performed duties relating to the Tent of Meeting, whom Moses and Aaron recorded at the command of the LORD through Moses.

content: 40 those recorded by the clans of their ancestral house came to 2,630.

content: 41 That was the enrollment of the Gershonite clans, all those performing duties relating to the Tent of Meeting whom Moses and Aaron recorded at the command of the LORD.
content_old: 41 That was the enrollment of the Gershonite clans, all those performing duties relating to the Tent of Meeting whom Moses and Aaron recorded at the command of the LORD.

content_old: 42 The enrollment of the Merarite clans by the clans of their ancestral house,

content: 43 from the age of thirty years up to the age of fifty, all who were subject to service for work relating to the Tent of Meeting—

content_old: 44 those recorded by their clans came to 3,200.

content: 45 That was the enrollment of the Merarite clans which Moses and Aaron recorded at the command of the LORD through Moses.
content_old: 45 That was the enrollment of the Merarite clans which Moses and Aaron recorded at the command of the LORD through Moses.

content: 46 All the Levites whom Moses, Aaron, and the chieftains of Israel recorded by the clans of their ancestral houses,
content_old: 46 All the Levites whom Moses, Aaron, and the chieftains of Israel recorded by the clans of their ancestral houses,

content: 47 from the age of thirty years up to the age of fifty, all who were subject to duties of service and porterage relating to the Tent of Meeting—

content: 1 The LORD spoke to Moses, saying:
content_old: 1 The LORD spoke to Moses, saying:

content: 2 Instruct the Israelites to remove from camp anyone with an eruption or a discharge and anyone defiled by a corpse.
content_old: 2 Instruct the Israelites to remove from camp anyone with an eruption or a discharge and anyone defiled by a corpse.

content: 3 Remove male and female alike; put them outside the camp so that they do not defile the camp of those in whose midst I dwell.
content_old: 3 Remove male and female alike; put them outside the camp so that they do not defile the camp of those in whose midst I dwell.

content: 4 The Israelites did so, putting them outside the camp; as the LORD had spoken to Moses, so the Israelites did.
content_old: 4 The Israelites did so, putting them outside the camp; as the LORD had spoken to Moses, so the Israelites did.

content: 5 The LORD spoke to Moses, saying:
content_old: 5 The LORD spoke to Moses, saying:

content: 6 Speak to the Israelites: When a man or woman commits any wrong toward a fellow man, thus breaking faith with the LORD, and that person realizes his guilt,
content_old: 6 Speak to the Israelites: When a man or woman commits any wrong toward a fellow man, thus breaking faith with the LORD, and that person realizes his guilt,

content: 7 he shall confess the wrong that he has done. He shall make restitution in the principal amount and add one-fifth to it, giving it to him whom he has wronged.
content_old: 7 he shall confess the wrong that he has done. He shall make restitution in the principal amount and add one-fifth to it, giving it to him whom he has wronged.

content: 8 If the man has no kinsman to whom restitution can be made, the amount repaid shall go to the LORD for the priest—in addition to the ram of expiation with which expiation is made on his behalf.
content_old: 8 If the man has no kinsman to whom restitution can be made, the amount repaid shall go to the LORD for the priest—in addition to the ram of expiation with which expiation is made on his behalf.

content: 9 So, too, any gift among the sacred donations that the Israelites offer shall be the priest’s.
content_old: 9 So, too, any gift among the sacred donations that the Israelites offer shall be the priest’s.

content: 10 And each shall retain his sacred donations: each priest shall keep what is given to him.
content_old: 10 And each shall retain his sacred donations: each priest shall keep what is given to him.

content: 11 The LORD spoke to Moses, saying:
content_old: 11 The LORD spoke to Moses, saying:

content: 12 Speak to the Israelite people and say to them: If any man’s wife has gone astray and broken faith with him
content_old: 12 Speak to the Israelite people and say to them: If any man’s wife has gone astray and broken faith with him

content: 13 in that a man has had carnal relations with her unbeknown to her husband, and she keeps secret the fact that she has defiled herself without being forced, and there is no witness against her—
content_old: 13 in that a man has had carnal relations with her unbeknown to her husband, and she keeps secret the fact that she has defiled herself without being forced, and there is no witness against her—

content: 14 but a fit of jealousy comes over him and he is wrought up about the wife who has defiled herself; or if a fit of jealousy comes over one and he is wrought up about his wife although she has not defiled herself—
content_old: 14 but a fit of jealousy comes over him and he is wrought up about the wife who has defiled herself; or if a fit of jealousy comes over one and he is wrought up about his wife although she has not defiled herself—

content: 15 the man shall bring his wife to the priest. And he shall bring as an offering for her one-tenth of an ephah of barley flour. No oil shall be poured upon it and no frankincense shall be laid on it, for it is a meal offering of jealousy, a meal offering of remembrance which recalls wrongdoing.
content_old: 15 the man shall bring his wife to the priest. And he shall bring as an offering for her one-tenth of an ephah of barley flour. No oil shall be poured upon it and no frankincense shall be laid on it, for it is a meal offering of jealousy, a meal offering of remembrance which recalls wrongdoing.

content: 16 The priest shall bring her forward and have her stand before the LORD.
content_old: 16 The priest shall bring her forward and have her stand before the LORD.

content: 17 The priest shall take sacral water in an earthen vessel and, taking some of the earth that is on the floor of the Tabernacle, the priest shall put it into the water.
content_old: 17 The priest shall take sacral water in an earthen vessel and, taking some of the earth that is on the floor of the Tabernacle, the priest shall put it into the water.

content: 18 After he has made the woman stand before the LORD, the priest shall bare the woman’s head and place upon her hands the meal offering of remembrance, which is a meal offering of jealousy. And in the priest’s hands shall be the water of bitterness that induces the spell.
content_old: 18 After he has made the woman stand before the LORD, the priest shall bare the woman’s head and place upon her hands the meal offering of remembrance, which is a meal offering of jealousy. And in the priest’s hands shall be the water of bitterness that induces the spell.

content: 19 The priest shall adjure the woman, saying to her, “If no man has lain with you, if you have not gone astray in defilement while married to your husband, be immune to harm from this water of bitterness that induces the spell.
content_old: 19 The priest shall adjure the woman, saying to her, “If no man has lain with you, if you have not gone astray in defilement while married to your husband, be immune to harm from this water of bitterness that induces the spell.

content: 20 But if you have gone astray while married to your husband and have defiled yourself, if a man other than your husband has had carnal relations with you”—
content_old: 20 But if you have gone astray while married to your husband and have defiled yourself, if a man other than your husband has had carnal relations with you”—

content: 21 here the priest shall administer the curse of adjuration to the woman, as the priest goes on to say to the woman—“may the LORD make you a curse and an imprecation among your people, as the LORD causes your thigh to sag and your belly to distend;
content_old: 21 here the priest shall administer the curse of adjuration to the woman, as the priest goes on to say to the woman—“may the LORD make you a curse and an imprecation among your people, as the LORD causes your thigh to sag and your belly to distend;

content: 22 may this water that induces the spell enter your body, causing the belly to distend and the thigh to sag.” And the woman shall say, “Amen, amen!”
content_old: 22 may this water that induces the spell enter your body, causing the belly to distend and the thigh to sag.” And the woman shall say, “Amen, amen!”

content: 23 The priest shall put these curses down in writing and rub it off into the water of bitterness.
content_old: 23 The priest shall put these curses down in writing and rub it off into the water of bitterness.

content: 24 He is to make the woman drink the water of bitterness that induces the spell, so that the spell-inducing water may enter into her to bring on bitterness.
content_old: 24 He is to make the woman drink the water of bitterness that induces the spell, so that the spell-inducing water may enter into her to bring on bitterness.

content: 25 Then the priest shall take from the woman’s hand the meal offering of jealousy, elevate the meal offering before the LORD, and present it on the altar.
content_old: 25 Then the priest shall take from the woman’s hand the meal offering of jealousy, elevate the meal offering before the LORD, and present it on the altar.

content: 26 The priest shall scoop out of the meal offering a token part of it and turn it into smoke on the altar. Last, he shall make the woman drink the water.
content_old: 26 The priest shall scoop out of the meal offering a token part of it and turn it into smoke on the altar. Last, he shall make the woman drink the water.

content: 27 Once he has made her drink the water—if she has defiled herself by breaking faith with her husband, the spell-inducing water shall enter into her to bring on bitterness, so that her belly shall distend and her thigh shall sag; and the woman shall become a curse among her people.
content_old: 27 Once he has made her drink the water—if she has defiled herself by breaking faith with her husband, the spell-inducing water shall enter into her to bring on bitterness, so that her belly shall distend and her thigh shall sag; and the woman shall become a curse among her people.

content: 28 But if the woman has not defiled herself and is pure, she shall be unharmed and able to retain seed.
content_old: 28 But if the woman has not defiled herself and is pure, she shall be unharmed and able to retain seed.

content: 29 This is the ritual in cases of jealousy, when a woman goes astray while married to her husband and defiles herself,
content_old: 29 This is the ritual in cases of jealousy, when a woman goes astray while married to her husband and defiles herself,

content: 30 or when a fit of jealousy comes over a man and he is wrought up over his wife: the woman shall be made to stand before the LORD and the priest shall carry out all this ritual with her.
content_old: 30 or when a fit of jealousy comes over a man and he is wrought up over his wife: the woman shall be made to stand before the LORD and the priest shall carry out all this ritual with her.

content: 1 The LORD spoke to Moses, saying:
content_old: 1 The LORD spoke to Moses, saying:

content: 2 Speak to the Israelites and say to them: If anyone, man or woman, explicitly utters a nazirite’s vow, to set himself apart for the LORD,
content_old: 2 Speak to the Israelites and say to them: If anyone, man or woman, explicitly utters a nazirite’s vow, to set himself apart for the LORD,

content: 3 he shall abstain from wine and any other intoxicant; he shall not drink vinegar of wine or of any other intoxicant, neither shall he drink anything in which grapes have been steeped, nor eat grapes fresh or dried.
content_old: 3 he shall abstain from wine and any other intoxicant; he shall not drink vinegar of wine or of any other intoxicant, neither shall he drink anything in which grapes have been steeped, nor eat grapes fresh or dried.

content: 4 Throughout his term as nazirite, he may not eat anything that is obtained from the grapevine, even seeds or skin.
content_old: 4 Throughout his term as nazirite, he may not eat anything that is obtained from the grapevine, even seeds or skin.

content: 5 Throughout the term of his vow as nazirite, no razor shall touch his head; it shall remain consecrated until the completion of his term as nazirite of the LORD, the hair of his head being left to grow untrimmed.
content_old: 5 Throughout the term of his vow as nazirite, no razor shall touch his head; it shall remain consecrated until the completion of his term as nazirite of the LORD, the hair of his head being left to grow untrimmed.

content: 6 Throughout the term that he has set apart for the LORD, he shall not go in where there is a dead person.
content_old: 6 Throughout the term that he has set apart for the LORD, he shall not go in where there is a dead person.

content: 7 Even if his father or mother, or his brother or sister should die, he must not defile himself for them, since hair set apart for his God is upon his head:
content_old: 7 Even if his father or mother, or his brother or sister should die, he must not defile himself for them, since hair set apart for his God is upon his head:

content: 8 throughout his term as nazirite he is consecrated to the LORD.
content_old: 8 throughout his term as nazirite he is consecrated to the LORD.

content: 9 If a person dies suddenly near him, defiling his consecrated hair, he shall shave his head on the day he becomes clean; he shall shave it on the seventh day.
content_old: 9 If a person dies suddenly near him, defiling his consecrated hair, he shall shave his head on the day he becomes clean; he shall shave it on the seventh day.

content: 10 On the eighth day he shall bring two turtledoves or two pigeons to the priest, at the entrance of the Tent of Meeting.
content_old: 10 On the eighth day he shall bring two turtledoves or two pigeons to the priest, at the entrance of the Tent of Meeting.

content: 11 The priest shall offer one as a sin offering and the other as a burnt offering, and make expiation on his behalf for the guilt that he incurred through the corpse. That same day he shall reconsecrate his head
content_old: 11 The priest shall offer one as a sin offering and the other as a burnt offering, and make expiation on his behalf for the guilt that he incurred through the corpse. That same day he shall reconsecrate his head

content: 12 and rededicate to the LORD his term as nazirite; and he shall bring a lamb in its first year as a penalty offering. The previous period shall be void, since his consecrated hair was defiled.
content_old: 12 and rededicate to the LORD his term as nazirite; and he shall bring a lamb in its first year as a penalty offering. The previous period shall be void, since his consecrated hair was defiled.

content: 13 This is the ritual for the nazirite: On the day that his term as nazirite is completed, he shall be brought to the entrance of the Tent of Meeting.
content_old: 13 This is the ritual for the nazirite: On the day that his term as nazirite is completed, he shall be brought to the entrance of the Tent of Meeting.

content: 14 As his offering to the LORD he shall present: one male lamb in its first year, without blemish, for a burnt offering; one ewe lamb in its first year, without blemish, for a sin offering; one ram without blemish for an offering of well-being;
content_old: 14 As his offering to the LORD he shall present: one male lamb in its first year, without blemish, for a burnt offering; one ewe lamb in its first year, without blemish, for a sin offering; one ram without blemish for an offering of well-being;

content: 15 a basket of unleavened cakes of choice flour with oil mixed in, and unleavened wafers spread with oil; and the proper meal offerings and libations.
content_old: 15 a basket of unleavened cakes of choice flour with oil mixed in, and unleavened wafers spread with oil; and the proper meal offerings and libations.

content: 16 The priest shall present them before the LORD and offer the sin offering and the burnt offering.
content_old: 16 The priest shall present them before the LORD and offer the sin offering and the burnt offering.

content: 17 He shall offer the ram as a sacrifice of well-being to the LORD, together with the basket of unleavened cakes; the priest shall also offer the meal offerings and the libations.
content_old: 17 He shall offer the ram as a sacrifice of well-being to the LORD, together with the basket of unleavened cakes; the priest shall also offer the meal offerings and the libations.

content: 18 The nazirite shall then shave his consecrated hair, at the entrance of the Tent of Meeting, and take the locks of his consecrated hair and put them on the fire that is under the sacrifice of well-being.
content_old: 18 The nazirite shall then shave his consecrated hair, at the entrance of the Tent of Meeting, and take the locks of his consecrated hair and put them on the fire that is under the sacrifice of well-being.

content: 19 The priest shall take the shoulder of the ram when it has been boiled, one unleavened cake from the basket, and one unleavened wafer, and place them on the hands of the nazirite after he has shaved his consecrated hair.
content_old: 19 The priest shall take the shoulder of the ram when it has been boiled, one unleavened cake from the basket, and one unleavened wafer, and place them on the hands of the nazirite after he has shaved his consecrated hair.

content: 20 The priest shall elevate them as an elevation offering before the LORD; and this shall be a sacred donation for the priest, in addition to the breast of the elevation offering and the thigh of gift offering. After that the nazirite may drink wine.
content_old: 20 The priest shall elevate them as an elevation offering before the LORD; and this shall be a sacred donation for the priest, in addition to the breast of the elevation offering and the thigh of gift offering. After that the nazirite may drink wine.

content: 21 Such is the obligation of a nazirite; except that he who vows an offering to the LORD of what he can afford, beyond his nazirite requirements, must do exactly according to the vow that he has made beyond his obligation as a nazirite.

content: 1 The LORD spoke to Moses, saying:
content_old: 1 The LORD spoke to Moses, saying:

content: 2 Speak to Aaron and say to him, “When you mount the lamps, let the seven lamps give light at the front of the lampstand.”
content_old: 2 Speak to Aaron and say to him, “When you mount the lamps, let the seven lamps give light at the front of the lampstand.”

content: 3 Aaron did so; he mounted the lamps at the front of the lampstand, as the LORD had commanded Moses.—
content_old: 3 Aaron did so; he mounted the lamps at the front of the lampstand, as the LORD had commanded Moses.—

content: 4 Now this is how the lampstand was made: it was hammered work of gold, hammered from base to petal. According to the pattern that the LORD had shown Moses, so was the lampstand made.
content_old: 4 Now this is how the lampstand was made: it was hammered work of gold, hammered from base to petal. According to the pattern that the LORD had shown Moses, so was the lampstand made.

content: 5 The LORD spoke to Moses, saying:
content_old: 5 The LORD spoke to Moses, saying:

content: 6 Take the Levites from among the Israelites and cleanse them.
content_old: 6 Take the Levites from among the Israelites and cleanse them.

content: 7 This is what you shall do to them to cleanse them: sprinkle on them water of purification, and let them go over their whole body with a razor, and wash their clothes; thus they shall be cleansed.
content_old: 7 This is what you shall do to them to cleanse them: sprinkle on them water of purification, and let them go over their whole body with a razor, and wash their clothes; thus they shall be cleansed.

content: 8 Let them take a bull of the herd, and with it a meal offering of choice flour with oil mixed in, and you take a second bull of the herd for a sin offering.
content_old: 8 Let them take a bull of the herd, and with it a meal offering of choice flour with oil mixed in, and you take a second bull of the herd for a sin offering.

content: 9 You shall bring the Levites forward before the Tent of Meeting. Assemble the whole Israelite community,
content_old: 9 You shall bring the Levites forward before the Tent of Meeting. Assemble the whole Israelite community,

content: 10 and bring the Levites forward before the LORD. Let the Israelites lay their hands upon the Levites,
content_old: 10 and bring the Levites forward before the LORD. Let the Israelites lay their hands upon the Levites,

content: 11 and let Aaron designate the Levites before the LORD as an elevation offering from the Israelites, that they may perform the service of the LORD.
content_old: 11 and let Aaron designate the Levites before the LORD as an elevation offering from the Israelites, that they may perform the service of the LORD.

content: 12 The Levites shall now lay their hands upon the heads of the bulls; one shall be offered to the LORD as a sin offering and the other as a burnt offering, to make expiation for the Levites.
content_old: 12 The Levites shall now lay their hands upon the heads of the bulls; one shall be offered to the LORD as a sin offering and the other as a burnt offering, to make expiation for the Levites.

content: 13 You shall place the Levites in attendance upon Aaron and his sons, and designate them as an elevation offering to the LORD.
content_old: 13 You shall place the Levites in attendance upon Aaron and his sons, and designate them as an elevation offering to the LORD.

content: 14 Thus you shall set the Levites apart from the Israelites, and the Levites shall be Mine.
content_old: 14 Thus you shall set the Levites apart from the Israelites, and the Levites shall be Mine.

content: 15 Thereafter the Levites shall be qualified for the service of the Tent of Meeting, once you have cleansed them and designated them as an elevation offering.
content_old: 15 Thereafter the Levites shall be qualified for the service of the Tent of Meeting, once you have cleansed them and designated them as an elevation offering.

content: 16 For they are formally assigned to Me from among the Israelites: I have taken them for Myself in place of all the first issue of the womb, of all the first-born of the Israelites.
content_old: 16 For they are formally assigned to Me from among the Israelites: I have taken them for Myself in place of all the first issue of the womb, of all the first-born of the Israelites.

content: 17 For every first-born among the Israelites, man as well as beast, is Mine; I consecrated them to Myself at the time that I smote every first-born in the land of Egypt.
content_old: 17 For every first-born among the Israelites, man as well as beast, is Mine; I consecrated them to Myself at the time that I smote every first-born in the land of Egypt.

content: 18 Now I take the Levites instead of every first-born of the Israelites;
content_old: 18 Now I take the Levites instead of every first-born of the Israelites;

content: 19 and from among the Israelites I formally assign the Levites to Aaron and his sons, to perform the service for the Israelites in the Tent of Meeting and to make expiation for the Israelites, so that no plague may afflict the Israelites for coming too near the sanctuary.
content_old: 19 and from among the Israelites I formally assign the Levites to Aaron and his sons, to perform the service for the Israelites in the Tent of Meeting and to make expiation for the Israelites, so that no plague may afflict the Israelites for coming too near the sanctuary.

content: 20 Moses, Aaron, and the whole Israelite community did with the Levites accordingly; just as the LORD had commanded Moses in regard to the Levites, so the Israelites did with them.
content_old: 20 Moses, Aaron, and the whole Israelite community did with the Levites accordingly; just as the LORD had commanded Moses in regard to the Levites, so the Israelites did with them.

content: 21 The Levites purified themselves and washed their clothes; and Aaron designated them as an elevation offering before the LORD, and Aaron made expiation for them to cleanse them.
content_old: 21 The Levites purified themselves and washed their clothes; and Aaron designated them as an elevation offering before the LORD, and Aaron made expiation for them to cleanse them.

content: 22 Thereafter the Levites were qualified to perform their service in the Tent of Meeting, under Aaron and his sons. As the LORD had commanded Moses in regard to the Levites, so they did to them.
content_old: 22 Thereafter the Levites were qualified to perform their service in the Tent of Meeting, under Aaron and his sons. As the LORD had commanded Moses in regard to the Levites, so they did to them.

content: 23 The LORD spoke to Moses, saying:
content_old: 23 The LORD spoke to Moses, saying:

content: 24 This is the rule for the Levites. From twenty-five years of age up they shall participate in the work force in the service of the Tent of Meeting;
content_old: 24 This is the rule for the Levites. From twenty-five years of age up they shall participate in the work force in the service of the Tent of Meeting;

content: 25 but at the age of fifty they shall retire from the work force and shall serve no more.
content_old: 25 but at the age of fifty they shall retire from the work force and shall serve no more.

content: 1 The LORD spoke to Moses in the wilderness of Sinai, on the first new moon of the second year following the exodus from the land of Egypt, saying:
content_old: 1 The LORD spoke to Moses in the wilderness of Sinai, on the first new moon of the second year following the exodus from the land of Egypt, saying:

content: 2 Let the Israelite people offer the passover sacrifice at its set time:
content_old: 2 Let the Israelite people offer the passover sacrifice at its set time:

content: 3 you shall offer it on the fourteenth day of this month, at twilight, at its set time; you shall offer it in accordance with all its rules and rites.
content_old: 3 you shall offer it on the fourteenth day of this month, at twilight, at its set time; you shall offer it in accordance with all its rules and rites.

content: 4 Moses instructed the Israelites to offer the passover sacrifice;
content_old: 4 Moses instructed the Israelites to offer the passover sacrifice;

content: 5 and they offered the passover sacrifice in the first month, on the fourteenth day of the month, at twilight, in the wilderness of Sinai. Just as the LORD had commanded Moses, so the Israelites did.
content_old: 5 and they offered the passover sacrifice in the first month, on the fourteenth day of the month, at twilight, in the wilderness of Sinai. Just as the LORD had commanded Moses, so the Israelites did.

content: 6 But there were some men who were unclean by reason of a corpse and could not offer the passover sacrifice on that day. Appearing that same day before Moses and Aaron,
content_old: 6 But there were some men who were unclean by reason of a corpse and could not offer the passover sacrifice on that day. Appearing that same day before Moses and Aaron,

content: 7 those men said to them, “Unclean though we are by reason of a corpse, why must we be debarred from presenting the LORD’s offering at its set time with the rest of the Israelites?”
content_old: 7 those men said to them, “Unclean though we are by reason of a corpse, why must we be debarred from presenting the LORD’s offering at its set time with the rest of the Israelites?”

content: 8 Moses said to them, “Stand by, and let me hear what instructions the LORD gives about you.”
content_old: 8 Moses said to them, “Stand by, and let me hear what instructions the LORD gives about you.”

content: 9 And the LORD spoke to Moses, saying:
content_old: 9 And the LORD spoke to Moses, saying:

content: 10 Speak to the Israelite people, saying: When any of you or of your posterity who are defiled by a corpse or are on a long journey would offer a passover sacrifice to the LORD,
content_old: 10 Speak to the Israelite people, saying: When any of you or of your posterity who are defiled by a corpse or are on a long journey would offer a passover sacrifice to the LORD,

content: 11 they shall offer it in the second month, on the fourteenth day of the month, at twilight. They shall eat it with unleavened bread and bitter herbs,
content_old: 11 they shall offer it in the second month, on the fourteenth day of the month, at twilight. They shall eat it with unleavened bread and bitter herbs,

content: 12 and they shall not leave any of it over until morning. They shall not break a bone of it. They shall offer it in strict accord with the law of the passover sacrifice.
content_old: 12 and they shall not leave any of it over until morning. They shall not break a bone of it. They shall offer it in strict accord with the law of the passover sacrifice.

content: 13 But if a man who is clean and not on a journey refrains from offering the passover sacrifice, that person shall be cut off from his kin, for he did not present the LORD’s offering at its set time; that man shall bear his guilt.
content_old: 13 But if a man who is clean and not on a journey refrains from offering the passover sacrifice, that person shall be cut off from his kin, for he did not present the LORD’s offering at its set time; that man shall bear his guilt.

content: 14 And when a stranger who resides with you would offer a passover sacrifice to the LORD, he must offer it in accordance with the rules and rites of the passover sacrifice. There shall be one law for you, whether stranger or citizen of the country.
content_old: 14 And when a stranger who resides with you would offer a passover sacrifice to the LORD, he must offer it in accordance with the rules and rites of the passover sacrifice. There shall be one law for you, whether stranger or citizen of the country.

content: 15 On the day that the Tabernacle was set up, the cloud covered the Tabernacle, the Tent of the Pact; and in the evening it rested over the Tabernacle in the likeness of fire until morning.
content_old: 15 On the day that the Tabernacle was set up, the cloud covered the Tabernacle, the Tent of the Pact; and in the evening it rested over the Tabernacle in the likeness of fire until morning.

content: 16 It was always so: the cloud covered it, appearing as fire by night.
content_old: 16 It was always so: the cloud covered it, appearing as fire by night.

content: 17 And whenever the cloud lifted from the Tent, the Israelites would set out accordingly; and at the spot where the cloud settled, there the Israelites would make camp.
content_old: 17 And whenever the cloud lifted from the Tent, the Israelites would set out accordingly; and at the spot where the cloud settled, there the Israelites would make camp.

content: 18 At a command of the LORD the Israelites broke camp, and at a command of the LORD they made camp: they remained encamped as long as the cloud stayed over the Tabernacle.
content_old: 18 At a command of the LORD the Israelites broke camp, and at a command of the LORD they made camp: they remained encamped as long as the cloud stayed over the Tabernacle.

content: 19 When the cloud lingered over the Tabernacle many days, the Israelites observed the LORD’s mandate and did not journey on.
content_old: 19 When the cloud lingered over the Tabernacle many days, the Israelites observed the LORD’s mandate and did not journey on.

content: 20 At such times as the cloud rested over the Tabernacle for but a few days, they remained encamped at a command of the LORD, and broke camp at a command of the LORD.
content_old: 20 At such times as the cloud rested over the Tabernacle for but a few days, they remained encamped at a command of the LORD, and broke camp at a command of the LORD.

content: 21 And at such times as the cloud stayed from evening until morning, they broke camp as soon as the cloud lifted in the morning. Day or night, whenever the cloud lifted, they would break camp.
content_old: 21 And at such times as the cloud stayed from evening until morning, they broke camp as soon as the cloud lifted in the morning. Day or night, whenever the cloud lifted, they would break camp.

content: 22 Whether it was two days or a month or a year—however long the cloud lingered over the Tabernacle—the Israelites remained encamped and did not set out; only when it lifted did they break camp.
content_old: 22 Whether it was two days or a month or a year—however long the cloud lingered over the Tabernacle—the Israelites remained encamped and did not set out; only when it lifted did they break camp.

content: 1 The LORD spoke to Moses, saying:
content_old: 1 The LORD spoke to Moses, saying:

content: 2 Have two silver trumpets made; make them of hammered work. They shall serve you to summon the community and to set the divisions in motion.
content_old: 2 Have two silver trumpets made; make them of hammered work. They shall serve you to summon the community and to set the divisions in motion.

content: 3 When both are blown in long blasts, the whole community shall assemble before you at the entrance of the Tent of Meeting;
content_old: 3 When both are blown in long blasts, the whole community shall assemble before you at the entrance of the Tent of Meeting;

content: 4 and if only one is blown, the chieftains, heads of Israel’s contingents, shall assemble before you.
content_old: 4 and if only one is blown, the chieftains, heads of Israel’s contingents, shall assemble before you.

content: 5 But when you sound short blasts, the divisions encamped on the east shall move forward;
content_old: 5 But when you sound short blasts, the divisions encamped on the east shall move forward;

content: 6 and when you sound short blasts a second time, those encamped on the south shall move forward. Thus short blasts shall be blown for setting them in motion,
content_old: 6 and when you sound short blasts a second time, those encamped on the south shall move forward. Thus short blasts shall be blown for setting them in motion,

content: 7 while to convoke the congregation you shall blow long blasts, not short ones.
content_old: 7 while to convoke the congregation you shall blow long blasts, not short ones.

content: 8 The trumpets shall be blown by Aaron’s sons, the priests; they shall be for you an institution for all time throughout the ages.
content_old: 8 The trumpets shall be blown by Aaron’s sons, the priests; they shall be for you an institution for all time throughout the ages.

content: 9 When you are at war in your land against an aggressor who attacks you, you shall sound short blasts on the trumpets, that you may be remembered before the LORD your God and be delivered from your enemies.
content_old: 9 When you are at war in your land against an aggressor who attacks you, you shall sound short blasts on the trumpets, that you may be remembered before the LORD your God and be delivered from your enemies.

content: 10 And on your joyous occasions—your fixed festivals and new moon days—you shall sound the trumpets over your burnt offerings and your sacrifices of well-being. They shall be a reminder of you before your God: I, the LORD, am your God.
content_old: 10 And on your joyous occasions—your fixed festivals and new moon days—you shall sound the trumpets over your burnt offerings and your sacrifices of well-being. They shall be a reminder of you before your God: I, the LORD, am your God.

content: 11 In the second year, on the twentieth day of the second month, the cloud lifted from the Tabernacle of the Pact
content_old: 11 In the second year, on the twentieth day of the second month, the cloud lifted from the Tabernacle of the Pact

content: 12 and the Israelites set out on their journeys from the wilderness of Sinai. The cloud came to rest in the wilderness of Paran.
content_old: 12 and the Israelites set out on their journeys from the wilderness of Sinai. The cloud came to rest in the wilderness of Paran.

content: 13 When the march was to begin, at the LORD’s command through Moses,
content_old: 13 When the march was to begin, at the LORD’s command through Moses,

content: 14 the first standard to set out, troop by troop, was the division of Judah. In command of its troops was Nahshon son of Amminadab;
content_old: 14 the first standard to set out, troop by troop, was the division of Judah. In command of its troops was Nahshon son of Amminadab;

content: 15 in command of the tribal troop of Issachar, Nethanel son of Zuar;
content_old: 15 in command of the tribal troop of Issachar, Nethanel son of Zuar;

content: 16 and in command of the tribal troop of Zebulun, Eliab son of Helon.
content_old: 16 and in command of the tribal troop of Zebulun, Eliab son of Helon.

content: 17 Then the Tabernacle would be taken apart; and the Gershonites and the Merarites, who carried the Tabernacle, would set out.
content_old: 17 Then the Tabernacle would be taken apart; and the Gershonites and the Merarites, who carried the Tabernacle, would set out.

content: 18 The next standard to set out, troop by troop, was the division of Reuben. In command of its troop was Elizur son of Shedeur;
content_old: 18 The next standard to set out, troop by troop, was the division of Reuben. In command of its troop was Elizur son of Shedeur;

content: 19 in command of the tribal troop of Simeon, Shelumiel son of Zurishaddai;
content_old: 19 in command of the tribal troop of Simeon, Shelumiel son of Zurishaddai;

content: 20 and in command of the tribal troop of Gad, Eliasaph son of Deuel.
content_old: 20 and in command of the tribal troop of Gad, Eliasaph son of Deuel.

content: 21 Then the Kohathites, who carried the sacred objects, would set out; and by the time they arrived, the Tabernacle would be set up again.
content_old: 21 Then the Kohathites, who carried the sacred objects, would set out; and by the time they arrived, the Tabernacle would be set up again.

content: 22 The next standard to set out, troop by troop, was the division of Ephraim. In command of its troop was Elishama son of Ammihud;
content_old: 22 The next standard to set out, troop by troop, was the division of Ephraim. In command of its troop was Elishama son of Ammihud;

content: 23 in command of the tribal troop of Manasseh, Gamaliel son of Pedahzur;
content_old: 23 in command of the tribal troop of Manasseh, Gamaliel son of Pedahzur;

content: 24 and in command of the tribal troop of Benjamin, Abidan son of Gideoni.
content_old: 24 and in command of the tribal troop of Benjamin, Abidan son of Gideoni.

content: 25 Then, as the rear guard of all the divisions, the standard of the division of Dan would set out, troop by troop. In command of its troop was Ahiezer son of Ammishaddai;
content_old: 25 Then, as the rear guard of all the divisions, the standard of the division of Dan would set out, troop by troop. In command of its troop was Ahiezer son of Ammishaddai;

content: 26 in command of the tribal troop of Asher, Pagiel son of Ochran;
content_old: 26 in command of the tribal troop of Asher, Pagiel son of Ochran;

content: 27 and in command of the tribal troop of Naphtali, Ahira son of Enan.
content_old: 27 and in command of the tribal troop of Naphtali, Ahira son of Enan.

content: 28 Such was the order of march of the Israelites, as they marched troop by troop.
content_old: 28 Such was the order of march of the Israelites, as they marched troop by troop.

content: 29 Moses said to Hobab son of Reuel the Midianite, Moses’ father-in-law, “We are setting out for the place of which the LORD has said, ‘I will give it to you.’ Come with us and we will be generous with you; for the LORD has promised to be generous to Israel.”
content_old: 29 Moses said to Hobab son of Reuel the Midianite, Moses’ father-in-law, “We are setting out for the place of which the LORD has said, ‘I will give it to you.’ Come with us and we will be generous with you; for the LORD has promised to be generous to Israel.”

content: 30 “I will not go,” he replied to him, “but will return to my native land.”
content_old: 30 “I will not go,” he replied to him, “but will return to my native land.”

content: 31 He said, “Please do not leave us, inasmuch as you know where we should camp in the wilderness and can be our guide.
content_old: 31 He said, “Please do not leave us, inasmuch as you know where we should camp in the wilderness and can be our guide.

content: 32 So if you come with us, we will extend to you the same bounty that the LORD grants us.”
content_old: 32 So if you come with us, we will extend to you the same bounty that the LORD grants us.”

content: 33 They marched from the mountain of the LORD a distance of three days. The Ark of the Covenant of the LORD traveled in front of them on that three days’ journey to seek out a resting place for them;
content_old: 33 They marched from the mountain of the LORD a distance of three days. The Ark of the Covenant of the LORD traveled in front of them on that three days’ journey to seek out a resting place for them;

content: 34 and the LORD’s cloud kept above them by day, as they moved on from camp.
content_old: 34 and the LORD’s cloud kept above them by day, as they moved on from camp.

content: 35 When the Ark was to set out, Moses would say: Advance, O LORD! May Your enemies be scattered, And may Your foes flee before You!
content_old: 35 When the Ark was to set out, Moses would say: Advance, O LORD! May Your enemies be scattered, And may Your foes flee before You!

content: 1 The people took to complaining bitterly before the LORD. The LORD heard and was incensed: a fire of the LORD broke out against them, ravaging the outskirts of the camp.
content_old: 1 The people took to complaining bitterly before the LORD. The LORD heard and was incensed: a fire of the LORD broke out against them, ravaging the outskirts of the camp.

content: 2 The people cried out to Moses. Moses prayed to the LORD, and the fire died down.
content_old: 2 The people cried out to Moses. Moses prayed to the LORD, and the fire died down.

content: 3 That place was named Taberah, because a fire of the LORD had broken out against them.
content_old: 3 That place was named Taberah, because a fire of the LORD had broken out against them.

content: 4 The riffraff in their midst felt a gluttonous craving; and then the Israelites wept and said, “If only we had meat to eat!
content_old: 4 The riffraff in their midst felt a gluttonous craving; and then the Israelites wept and said, “If only we had meat to eat!

content: 5 We remember the fish that we used to eat free in Egypt, the cucumbers, the melons, the leeks, the onions, and the garlic.
content_old: 5 We remember the fish that we used to eat free in Egypt, the cucumbers, the melons, the leeks, the onions, and the garlic.

content: 6 Now our gullets are shriveled. There is nothing at all! Nothing but this manna to look to!”
content_old: 6 Now our gullets are shriveled. There is nothing at all! Nothing but this manna to look to!”

content: 7 Now the manna was like coriander seed, and in color it was like bdellium.
content_old: 7 Now the manna was like coriander seed, and in color it was like bdellium.

content: 8 The people would go about and gather it, grind it between millstones or pound it in a mortar, boil it in a pot, and make it into cakes. It tasted like rich cream.
content_old: 8 The people would go about and gather it, grind it between millstones or pound it in a mortar, boil it in a pot, and make it into cakes. It tasted like rich cream.

content: 9 When the dew fell on the camp at night, the manna would fall upon it.
content_old: 9 When the dew fell on the camp at night, the manna would fall upon it.

content: 10 Moses heard the people weeping, every clan apart, each person at the entrance of his tent. The LORD was very angry, and Moses was distressed.
content_old: 10 Moses heard the people weeping, every clan apart, each person at the entrance of his tent. The LORD was very angry, and Moses was distressed.

content: 11 And Moses said to the LORD, “Why have You dealt ill with Your servant, and why have I not enjoyed Your favor, that You have laid the burden of all this people upon me?
content_old: 11 And Moses said to the LORD, “Why have You dealt ill with Your servant, and why have I not enjoyed Your favor, that You have laid the burden of all this people upon me?

content: 12 Did I conceive all this people, did I bear them, that You should say to me, ‘Carry them in your bosom as a nurse carries an infant,’ to the land that You have promised on oath to their fathers?
content_old: 12 Did I conceive all this people, did I bear them, that You should say to me, ‘Carry them in your bosom as a nurse carries an infant,’ to the land that You have promised on oath to their fathers?

content: 13 Where am I to get meat to give to all this people, when they whine before me and say, ‘Give us meat to eat!’
content_old: 13 Where am I to get meat to give to all this people, when they whine before me and say, ‘Give us meat to eat!’

content: 14 I cannot carry all this people by myself, for it is too much for me.
content_old: 14 I cannot carry all this people by myself, for it is too much for me.

content: 15 If You would deal thus with me, kill me rather, I beg You, and let me see no more of my wretchedness!”
content_old: 15 If You would deal thus with me, kill me rather, I beg You, and let me see no more of my wretchedness!”

content: 16 Then the LORD said to Moses, “Gather for Me seventy of Israel’s elders of whom you have experience as elders and officers of the people, and bring them to the Tent of Meeting and let them take their place there with you.
content_old: 16 Then the LORD said to Moses, “Gather for Me seventy of Israel’s elders of whom you have experience as elders and officers of the people, and bring them to the Tent of Meeting and let them take their place there with you.

content: 17 I will come down and speak with you there, and I will draw upon the spirit that is on you and put it upon them; they shall share the burden of the people with you, and you shall not bear it alone.
content_old: 17 I will come down and speak with you there, and I will draw upon the spirit that is on you and put it upon them; they shall share the burden of the people with you, and you shall not bear it alone.

content: 18 And say to the people: Purify yourselves for tomorrow and you shall eat meat, for you have kept whining before the LORD and saying, ‘If only we had meat to eat! Indeed, we were better off in Egypt!’ The LORD will give you meat and you shall eat.
content_old: 18 And say to the people: Purify yourselves for tomorrow and you shall eat meat, for you have kept whining before the LORD and saying, ‘If only we had meat to eat! Indeed, we were better off in Egypt!’ The LORD will give you meat and you shall eat.

content: 19 You shall eat not one day, not two, not even five days or ten or twenty,
content_old: 19 You shall eat not one day, not two, not even five days or ten or twenty,

content: 20 but a whole month, until it comes out of your nostrils and becomes loathsome to you. For you have rejected the LORD who is among you, by whining before Him and saying, ‘Oh, why did we ever leave Egypt!’ ”
content_old: 20 but a whole month, until it comes out of your nostrils and becomes loathsome to you. For you have rejected the LORD who is among you, by whining before Him and saying, ‘Oh, why did we ever leave Egypt!’ ”

content: 21 But Moses said, “The people who are with me number six hundred thousand men; yet You say, ‘I will give them enough meat to eat for a whole month.’
content_old: 21 But Moses said, “The people who are with me number six hundred thousand men; yet You say, ‘I will give them enough meat to eat for a whole month.’

content: 22 Could enough flocks and herds be slaughtered to suffice them? Or could all the fish of the sea be gathered for them to suffice them?”
content_old: 22 Could enough flocks and herds be slaughtered to suffice them? Or could all the fish of the sea be gathered for them to suffice them?”

content: 23 And the LORD answered Moses, “Is there a limit to the LORD’s power? You shall soon see whether what I have said happens to you or not!”
content_old: 23 And the LORD answered Moses, “Is there a limit to the LORD’s power? You shall soon see whether what I have said happens to you or not!”

content: 24 Moses went out and reported the words of the LORD to the people. He gathered seventy of the people’s elders and stationed them around the Tent.
content_old: 24 Moses went out and reported the words of the LORD to the people. He gathered seventy of the people’s elders and stationed them around the Tent.

content: 25 Then the LORD came down in a cloud and spoke to him; He drew upon the spirit that was on him and put it upon the seventy elders. And when the spirit rested upon them, they spoke in ecstasy, but did not continue.
content_old: 25 Then the LORD came down in a cloud and spoke to him; He drew upon the spirit that was on him and put it upon the seventy elders. And when the spirit rested upon them, they spoke in ecstasy, but did not continue.

content: 26 Two men, one named Eldad and the other Medad, had remained in camp; yet the spirit rested upon them—they were among those recorded, but they had not gone out to the Tent—and they spoke in ecstasy in the camp.
content_old: 26 Two men, one named Eldad and the other Medad, had remained in camp; yet the spirit rested upon them—they were among those recorded, but they had not gone out to the Tent—and they spoke in ecstasy in the camp.

content: 27 A youth ran out and told Moses, saying, “Eldad and Medad are acting the prophet in the camp!”
content_old: 27 A youth ran out and told Moses, saying, “Eldad and Medad are acting the prophet in the camp!”

content: 28 And Joshua son of Nun, Moses’ attendant from his youth, spoke up and said, “My lord Moses, restrain them!”
content_old: 28 And Joshua son of Nun, Moses’ attendant from his youth, spoke up and said, “My lord Moses, restrain them!”

content: 29 But Moses said to him, “Are you wrought up on my account? Would that all the LORD’s people were prophets, that the LORD put His spirit upon them!”
content_old: 29 But Moses said to him, “Are you wrought up on my account? Would that all the LORD’s people were prophets, that the LORD put His spirit upon them!”

content: 30 Moses then reentered the camp together with the elders of Israel.
content_old: 30 Moses then reentered the camp together with the elders of Israel.

content: 31 A wind from the LORD started up, swept quail from the sea and strewed them over the camp, about a day’s journey on this side and about a day’s journey on that side, all around the camp, and some two cubits deep on the ground.
content_old: 31 A wind from the LORD started up, swept quail from the sea and strewed them over the camp, about a day’s journey on this side and about a day’s journey on that side, all around the camp, and some two cubits deep on the ground.

content: 32 The people set to gathering quail all that day and night and all the next day—even he who gathered least had ten homers—and they spread them out all around the camp.
content_old: 32 The people set to gathering quail all that day and night and all the next day—even he who gathered least had ten homers—and they spread them out all around the camp.

content: 33 The meat was still between their teeth, nor yet chewed, when the anger of the LORD blazed forth against the people and the LORD struck the people with a very severe plague.
content_old: 33 The meat was still between their teeth, nor yet chewed, when the anger of the LORD blazed forth against the people and the LORD struck the people with a very severe plague.

content: 34 That place was named Kibroth-hattaavah, because the people who had the craving were buried there.
content_old: 34 That place was named Kibroth-hattaavah, because the people who had the craving were buried there.

content: 1 When they were in Hazeroth, Miriam and Aaron spoke against Moses because of the Cushite woman he had married: “He married a Cushite woman!”
content_old: 1 When they were in Hazeroth, Miriam and Aaron spoke against Moses because of the Cushite woman he had married: “He married a Cushite woman!”

content: 2 They said, “Has the LORD spoken only through Moses? Has He not spoken through us as well?” The LORD heard it.
content_old: 2 They said, “Has the LORD spoken only through Moses? Has He not spoken through us as well?” The LORD heard it.

content: 3 Now Moses was a very humble man, more so than any other man on earth.
content_old: 3 Now Moses was a very humble man, more so than any other man on earth.

content: 4 Suddenly the LORD called to Moses, Aaron, and Miriam, “Come out, you three, to the Tent of Meeting.” So the three of them went out.
content_old: 4 Suddenly the LORD called to Moses, Aaron, and Miriam, “Come out, you three, to the Tent of Meeting.” So the three of them went out.

content: 5 The LORD came down in a pillar of cloud, stopped at the entrance of the Tent, and called out, “Aaron and Miriam!” The two of them came forward;
content_old: 5 The LORD came down in a pillar of cloud, stopped at the entrance of the Tent, and called out, “Aaron and Miriam!” The two of them came forward;

content: 6 and He said, “Hear these My words: When a prophet of the LORD arises among you, I make Myself known to him in a vision, I speak with him in a dream.
content_old: 6 and He said, “Hear these My words: When a prophet of the LORD arises among you, I make Myself known to him in a vision, I speak with him in a dream.

content: 7 Not so with My servant Moses; he is trusted throughout My household.
content_old: 7 Not so with My servant Moses; he is trusted throughout My household.

content: 8 With him I speak mouth to mouth, plainly and not in riddles, and he beholds the likeness of the LORD. How then did you not shrink from speaking against My servant Moses!”
content_old: 8 With him I speak mouth to mouth, plainly and not in riddles, and he beholds the likeness of the LORD. How then did you not shrink from speaking against My servant Moses!”

content: 9 Still incensed with them, the LORD departed.
content_old: 9 Still incensed with them, the LORD departed.

content: 10 As the cloud withdrew from the Tent, there was Miriam stricken with snow-white scales! When Aaron turned toward Miriam, he saw that she was stricken with scales.
content_old: 10 As the cloud withdrew from the Tent, there was Miriam stricken with snow-white scales! When Aaron turned toward Miriam, he saw that she was stricken with scales.

content: 11 And Aaron said to Moses, “O my lord, account not to us the sin which we committed in our folly.
content_old: 11 And Aaron said to Moses, “O my lord, account not to us the sin which we committed in our folly.

content: 12 Let her not be as one dead, who emerges from his mother’s womb with half his flesh eaten away.”
content_old: 12 Let her not be as one dead, who emerges from his mother’s womb with half his flesh eaten away.”

content: 13 So Moses cried out to the LORD, saying, “O God, pray heal her!”
content_old: 13 So Moses cried out to the LORD, saying, “O God, pray heal her!”

content: 14 But the LORD said to Moses, “If her father spat in her face, would she not bear her shame for seven days? Let her be shut out of camp for seven days, and then let her be readmitted.”
content_old: 14 But the LORD said to Moses, “If her father spat in her face, would she not bear her shame for seven days? Let her be shut out of camp for seven days, and then let her be readmitted.”

content: 15 So Miriam was shut out of camp seven days; and the people did not march on until Miriam was readmitted.
content_old: 15 So Miriam was shut out of camp seven days; and the people did not march on until Miriam was readmitted.

content: 1 The LORD spoke to Moses, saying,
content_old: 1 The LORD spoke to Moses, saying,

content: 2 “Send men to scout the land of Canaan, which I am giving to the Israelite people; send one man from each of their ancestral tribes, each one a chieftain among them.”
content_old: 2 “Send men to scout the land of Canaan, which I am giving to the Israelite people; send one man from each of their ancestral tribes, each one a chieftain among them.”

content: 3 So Moses, by the LORD’s command, sent them out from the wilderness of Paran, all the men being leaders of the Israelites.
content_old: 3 So Moses, by the LORD’s command, sent them out from the wilderness of Paran, all the men being leaders of the Israelites.

content: 4 And these were their names: From the tribe of Reuben, Shammua son of Zaccur.
content_old: 4 And these were their names: From the tribe of Reuben, Shammua son of Zaccur.

content: 5 From the tribe of Simeon, Shaphat son of Hori.
content_old: 5 From the tribe of Simeon, Shaphat son of Hori.

content: 6 From the tribe of Judah, Caleb son of Jephunneh.
content_old: 6 From the tribe of Judah, Caleb son of Jephunneh.

content: 7 From the tribe of Issachar, Igal son of Joseph.
content_old: 7 From the tribe of Issachar, Igal son of Joseph.

content: 8 From the tribe of Ephraim, Hosea son of Nun.
content_old: 8 From the tribe of Ephraim, Hosea son of Nun.

content: 9 From the tribe of Benjamin, Palti son of Rafu.
content_old: 9 From the tribe of Benjamin, Palti son of Rafu.

content: 10 From the tribe of Zebulun, Gaddiel son of Sodi.
content_old: 10 From the tribe of Zebulun, Gaddiel son of Sodi.

content: 11 From the tribe of Joseph, namely, the tribe of Manasseh, Gaddi son of Susi.
content_old: 11 From the tribe of Joseph, namely, the tribe of Manasseh, Gaddi son of Susi.

content: 12 From the tribe of Dan, Ammiel son of Gemalli.
content_old: 12 From the tribe of Dan, Ammiel son of Gemalli.

content: 13 From the tribe of Asher, Sethur son of Michael.
content_old: 13 From the tribe of Asher, Sethur son of Michael.

content: 14 From the tribe of Naphtali, Nahbi son of Vophsi.
content_old: 14 From the tribe of Naphtali, Nahbi son of Vophsi.

content: 15 From the tribe of Gad, Geuel son of Machi.
content_old: 15 From the tribe of Gad, Geuel son of Machi.

content: 16 Those were the names of the men whom Moses sent to scout the land; but Moses changed the name of Hosea son of Nun to Joshua.
content_old: 16 Those were the names of the men whom Moses sent to scout the land; but Moses changed the name of Hosea son of Nun to Joshua.

content: 17 When Moses sent them to scout the land of Canaan, he said to them, “Go up there into the Negeb and on into the hill country,
content_old: 17 When Moses sent them to scout the land of Canaan, he said to them, “Go up there into the Negeb and on into the hill country,

content: 18 and see what kind of country it is. Are the people who dwell in it strong or weak, few or many?
content_old: 18 and see what kind of country it is. Are the people who dwell in it strong or weak, few or many?

content: 19 Is the country in which they dwell good or bad? Are the towns they live in open or fortified?
content_old: 19 Is the country in which they dwell good or bad? Are the towns they live in open or fortified?

content: 20 Is the soil rich or poor? Is it wooded or not? And take pains to bring back some of the fruit of the land.”—Now it happened to be the season of the first ripe grapes.
content_old: 20 Is the soil rich or poor? Is it wooded or not? And take pains to bring back some of the fruit of the land.”—Now it happened to be the season of the first ripe grapes.

content: 21 They went up and scouted the land, from the wilderness of Zin to Rehob, at Lebo-hamath.
content_old: 21 They went up and scouted the land, from the wilderness of Zin to Rehob, at Lebo-hamath.
