content: 22 They went up into the Negeb and came to Hebron, where lived Ahiman, Sheshai, and Talmai, the Anakites.—Now Hebron was founded seven years before Zoan of Egypt.—
content_old: 22 They went up into the Negeb and came to Hebron, where lived Ahiman, Sheshai, and Talmai, the Anakites.—Now Hebron was founded seven years before Zoan of Egypt.—

content: 23 They reached the wadi Eshcol, and there they cut down a branch with a single cluster of grapes—it had to be borne on a carrying frame by two of them—and some pomegranates and figs.
content_old: 23 They reached the wadi Eshcol, and there they cut down a branch with a single cluster of grapes—it had to be borne on a carrying frame by two of them—and some pomegranates and figs.

content: 24 That place was named the wadi Eshcol because of the cluster that the Israelites cut down there.
content_old: 24 That place was named the wadi Eshcol because of the cluster that the Israelites cut down there.

content: 25 At the end of forty days they returned from scouting the land.
content_old: 25 At the end of forty days they returned from scouting the land.

content: 26 They went straight to Moses and Aaron and the whole Israelite community at Kadesh in the wilderness of Paran, and they made their report to them and to the whole community, as they showed them the fruit of the land.
content_old: 26 They went straight to Moses and Aaron and the whole Israelite community at Kadesh in the wilderness of Paran, and they made their report to them and to the whole community, as they showed them the fruit of the land.

content: 27 This is what they told him: “We came to the land you sent us to; it does indeed flow with milk and honey, and this is its fruit.
content_old: 27 This is what they told him: “We came to the land you sent us to; it does indeed flow with milk and honey, and this is its fruit.

content: 28 However, the people who inhabit the country are powerful, and the cities are fortified and very large; moreover, we saw the Anakites there.
content_old: 28 However, the people who inhabit the country are powerful, and the cities are fortified and very large; moreover, we saw the Anakites there.

content: 29 Amalekites dwell in the Negeb region; Hittites, Jebusites, and Amorites inhabit the hill country; and Canaanites dwell by the Sea and along the Jordan.”
content_old: 29 Amalekites dwell in the Negeb region; Hittites, Jebusites, and Amorites inhabit the hill country; and Canaanites dwell by the Sea and along the Jordan.”

content: 30 Caleb hushed the people before Moses and said, “Let us by all means go up, and we shall gain possession of it, for we shall surely overcome it.”
content_old: 30 Caleb hushed the people before Moses and said, “Let us by all means go up, and we shall gain possession of it, for we shall surely overcome it.”

content: 31 But the men who had gone up with him said, “We cannot attack that people, for it is stronger than we.”
content_old: 31 But the men who had gone up with him said, “We cannot attack that people, for it is stronger than we.”

content: 32 Thus they spread calumnies among the Israelites about the land they had scouted, saying, “The country that we traversed and scouted is one that devours its settlers. All the people that we saw in it are men of great size;
content_old: 32 Thus they spread calumnies among the Israelites about the land they had scouted, saying, “The country that we traversed and scouted is one that devours its settlers. All the people that we saw in it are men of great size;

content: 1 The whole community broke into loud cries, and the people wept that night.
content_old: 1 The whole community broke into loud cries, and the people wept that night.

content: 2 All the Israelites railed against Moses and Aaron. “If only we had died in the land of Egypt,” the whole community shouted at them, “or if only we might die in this wilderness!
content_old: 2 All the Israelites railed against Moses and Aaron. “If only we had died in the land of Egypt,” the whole community shouted at them, “or if only we might die in this wilderness!

content: 3 Why is the LORD taking us to that land to fall by the sword? Our wives and children will be carried off! It would be better for us to go back to Egypt!”
content_old: 3 Why is the LORD taking us to that land to fall by the sword? Our wives and children will be carried off! It would be better for us to go back to Egypt!”

content: 4 And they said to one another, “Let us head back for Egypt.”
content_old: 4 And they said to one another, “Let us head back for Egypt.”

content: 5 Then Moses and Aaron fell on their faces before all the assembled congregation of the Israelites.
content_old: 5 Then Moses and Aaron fell on their faces before all the assembled congregation of the Israelites.

content: 6 And Joshua son of Nun and Caleb son of Jephunneh, of those who had scouted the land, rent their clothes
content_old: 6 And Joshua son of Nun and Caleb son of Jephunneh, of those who had scouted the land, rent their clothes

content: 7 and exhorted the whole Israelite community: “The land that we traversed and scouted is an exceedingly good land.
content_old: 7 and exhorted the whole Israelite community: “The land that we traversed and scouted is an exceedingly good land.

content: 8 If the LORD is pleased with us, He will bring us into that land, a land that flows with milk and honey, and give it to us;
content_old: 8 If the LORD is pleased with us, He will bring us into that land, a land that flows with milk and honey, and give it to us;

content: 9 only you must not rebel against the LORD. Have no fear then of the people of the country, for they are our prey: their protection has departed from them, but the LORD is with us. Have no fear of them!”
content_old: 9 only you must not rebel against the LORD. Have no fear then of the people of the country, for they are our prey: their protection has departed from them, but the LORD is with us. Have no fear of them!”

content: 10 As the whole community threatened to pelt them with stones, the Presence of the LORD appeared in the Tent of Meeting to all the Israelites.
content_old: 10 As the whole community threatened to pelt them with stones, the Presence of the LORD appeared in the Tent of Meeting to all the Israelites.

content: 11 And the LORD said to Moses, “How long will this people spurn Me, and how long will they have no faith in Me despite all the signs that I have performed in their midst?
content_old: 11 And the LORD said to Moses, “How long will this people spurn Me, and how long will they have no faith in Me despite all the signs that I have performed in their midst?

content: 12 I will strike them with pestilence and disown them, and I will make of you a nation far more numerous than they!”
content_old: 12 I will strike them with pestilence and disown them, and I will make of you a nation far more numerous than they!”

content: 13 But Moses said to the LORD, “When the Egyptians, from whose midst You brought up this people in Your might, hear the news,
content_old: 13 But Moses said to the LORD, “When the Egyptians, from whose midst You brought up this people in Your might, hear the news,

content: 14 they will tell it to the inhabitants of that land. Now they have heard that You, O LORD, are in the midst of this people; that You, O LORD, appear in plain sight when Your cloud rests over them and when You go before them in a pillar of cloud by day and in a pillar of fire by night.
content_old: 14 they will tell it to the inhabitants of that land. Now they have heard that You, O LORD, are in the midst of this people; that You, O LORD, appear in plain sight when Your cloud rests over them and when You go before them in a pillar of cloud by day and in a pillar of fire by night.

content: 15 If then You slay this people to a man, the nations who have heard Your fame will say,
content_old: 15 If then You slay this people to a man, the nations who have heard Your fame will say,

content: 16 ‘It must be because the LORD was powerless to bring that people into the land He had promised them on oath that He slaughtered them in the wilderness.’
content_old: 16 ‘It must be because the LORD was powerless to bring that people into the land He had promised them on oath that He slaughtered them in the wilderness.’

content: 17 Therefore, I pray, let my Lord’s forbearance be great, as You have declared, saying,
content_old: 17 Therefore, I pray, let my Lord’s forbearance be great, as You have declared, saying,

content: 18 ‘The LORD! slow to anger and abounding in kindness; forgiving iniquity and transgression; yet not remitting all punishment, but visiting the iniquity of fathers upon children, upon the third and fourth generations.’
content_old: 18 ‘The LORD! slow to anger and abounding in kindness; forgiving iniquity and transgression; yet not remitting all punishment, but visiting the iniquity of fathers upon children, upon the third and fourth generations.’

content: 19 Pardon, I pray, the iniquity of this people according to Your great kindness, as You have forgiven this people ever since Egypt.”
content_old: 19 Pardon, I pray, the iniquity of this people according to Your great kindness, as You have forgiven this people ever since Egypt.”

content: 20 And the LORD said, “I pardon, as you have asked.
content_old: 20 And the LORD said, “I pardon, as you have asked.

content: 21 Nevertheless, as I live and as the LORD’s Presence fills the whole world,
content_old: 21 Nevertheless, as I live and as the LORD’s Presence fills the whole world,

content: 22 none of the men who have seen My Presence and the signs that I have performed in Egypt and in the wilderness, and who have tried Me these many times and have disobeyed Me,
content_old: 22 none of the men who have seen My Presence and the signs that I have performed in Egypt and in the wilderness, and who have tried Me these many times and have disobeyed Me,

content: 23 shall see the land that I promised on oath to their fathers; none of those who spurn Me shall see it.
content_old: 23 shall see the land that I promised on oath to their fathers; none of those who spurn Me shall see it.

content: 24 But My servant Caleb, because he was imbued with a different spirit and remained loyal to Me—him will I bring into the land that he entered, and his offspring shall hold it as a possession.
content_old: 24 But My servant Caleb, because he was imbued with a different spirit and remained loyal to Me—him will I bring into the land that he entered, and his offspring shall hold it as a possession.

content: 25 Now the Amalekites and the Canaanites occupy the valleys. Start out, then, tomorrow and march into the wilderness by way of the Sea of Reeds.”
content_old: 25 Now the Amalekites and the Canaanites occupy the valleys. Start out, then, tomorrow and march into the wilderness by way of the Sea of Reeds.”

content: 26 The LORD spoke further to Moses and Aaron,
content_old: 26 The LORD spoke further to Moses and Aaron,

content: 27 “How much longer shall that wicked community keep muttering against Me? Very well, I have heeded the incessant muttering of the Israelites against Me.
content_old: 27 “How much longer shall that wicked community keep muttering against Me? Very well, I have heeded the incessant muttering of the Israelites against Me.

content: 28 Say to them: ‘As I live,’ says the LORD, ‘I will do to you just as you have urged Me.
content_old: 28 Say to them: ‘As I live,’ says the LORD, ‘I will do to you just as you have urged Me.

content: 29 In this very wilderness shall your carcasses drop. Of all of you who were recorded in your various lists from the age of twenty years up, you who have muttered against Me,
content_old: 29 In this very wilderness shall your carcasses drop. Of all of you who were recorded in your various lists from the age of twenty years up, you who have muttered against Me,

content: 30 not one shall enter the land in which I swore to settle you—save Caleb son of Jephunneh and Joshua son of Nun.
content_old: 30 not one shall enter the land in which I swore to settle you—save Caleb son of Jephunneh and Joshua son of Nun.

content: 31 Your children who, you said, would be carried off—these will I allow to enter; they shall know the land that you have rejected.
content_old: 31 Your children who, you said, would be carried off—these will I allow to enter; they shall know the land that you have rejected.

content: 32 But your carcasses shall drop in this wilderness,
content_old: 32 But your carcasses shall drop in this wilderness,

content: 33 while your children roam the wilderness for forty years, suffering for your faithlessness, until the last of your carcasses is down in the wilderness.
content_old: 33 while your children roam the wilderness for forty years, suffering for your faithlessness, until the last of your carcasses is down in the wilderness.

content: 34 You shall bear your punishment for forty years, corresponding to the number of days—forty days—that you scouted the land: a year for each day. Thus you shall know what it means to thwart Me.
content_old: 34 You shall bear your punishment for forty years, corresponding to the number of days—forty days—that you scouted the land: a year for each day. Thus you shall know what it means to thwart Me.

content: 35 I the LORD have spoken: Thus will I do to all that wicked band that has banded together against Me: in this very wilderness they shall die to the last man.’ ”
content_old: 35 I the LORD have spoken: Thus will I do to all that wicked band that has banded together against Me: in this very wilderness they shall die to the last man.’ ”

content: 36 As for the men whom Moses sent to scout the land, those who came back and caused the whole community to mutter against him by spreading calumnies about the land—
content_old: 36 As for the men whom Moses sent to scout the land, those who came back and caused the whole community to mutter against him by spreading calumnies about the land—

content: 37 those who spread such calumnies about the land died of plague, by the will of the LORD.
content_old: 37 those who spread such calumnies about the land died of plague, by the will of the LORD.

content: 38 Of those men who had gone to scout the land, only Joshua son of Nun and Caleb son of Jephunneh survived.
content_old: 38 Of those men who had gone to scout the land, only Joshua son of Nun and Caleb son of Jephunneh survived.

content: 39 When Moses repeated these words to all the Israelites, the people were overcome by grief.
content_old: 39 When Moses repeated these words to all the Israelites, the people were overcome by grief.

content: 40 Early next morning they set out toward the crest of the hill country, saying, “We are prepared to go up to the place that the LORD has spoken of, for we were wrong.”
content_old: 40 Early next morning they set out toward the crest of the hill country, saying, “We are prepared to go up to the place that the LORD has spoken of, for we were wrong.”

content: 41 But Moses said, “Why do you transgress the LORD’s command? This will not succeed.
content_old: 41 But Moses said, “Why do you transgress the LORD’s command? This will not succeed.

content: 42 Do not go up, lest you be routed by your enemies, for the LORD is not in your midst.
content_old: 42 Do not go up, lest you be routed by your enemies, for the LORD is not in your midst.

content: 43 For the Amalekites and the Canaanites will be there to face you, and you will fall by the sword, inasmuch as you have turned from following the LORD and the LORD will not be with you.”
content_old: 43 For the Amalekites and the Canaanites will be there to face you, and you will fall by the sword, inasmuch as you have turned from following the LORD and the LORD will not be with you.”

content: 44 Yet defiantly they marched toward the crest of the hill country, though neither the LORD’s Ark of the Covenant nor Moses stirred from the camp.
content_old: 44 Yet defiantly they marched toward the crest of the hill country, though neither the LORD’s Ark of the Covenant nor Moses stirred from the camp.

content: 1 The LORD spoke to Moses, saying:
content_old: 1 The LORD spoke to Moses, saying:

content: 2 Speak to the Israelite people and say to them: When you enter the land that I am giving you to settle in,
content_old: 2 Speak to the Israelite people and say to them: When you enter the land that I am giving you to settle in,

content: 3 and would present an offering by fire to the LORD from the herd or from the flock, be it burnt offering or sacrifice, in fulfillment of a vow explicitly uttered, or as a freewill offering, or at your fixed occasions, producing an odor pleasing to the LORD:
content_old: 3 and would present an offering by fire to the LORD from the herd or from the flock, be it burnt offering or sacrifice, in fulfillment of a vow explicitly uttered, or as a freewill offering, or at your fixed occasions, producing an odor pleasing to the LORD:

content: 4 The person who presents the offering to the LORD shall bring as a meal offering: a tenth of a measure of choice flour with a quarter of a hin of oil mixed in.
content_old: 4 The person who presents the offering to the LORD shall bring as a meal offering: a tenth of a measure of choice flour with a quarter of a hin of oil mixed in.

content: 5 You shall also offer, with the burnt offering or the sacrifice, a quarter of a hin of wine as a libation for each sheep.
content_old: 5 You shall also offer, with the burnt offering or the sacrifice, a quarter of a hin of wine as a libation for each sheep.

content: 6 In the case of a ram, you shall present as a meal offering: two-tenths of a measure of choice flour with a third of a hin of oil mixed in;
content_old: 6 In the case of a ram, you shall present as a meal offering: two-tenths of a measure of choice flour with a third of a hin of oil mixed in;

content: 7 and a third of a hin of wine as a libation—as an offering of pleasing odor to the LORD.
content_old: 7 and a third of a hin of wine as a libation—as an offering of pleasing odor to the LORD.

content: 8 And if it is an animal from the herd that you offer to the LORD as a burnt offering or as a sacrifice, in fulfillment of a vow explicitly uttered or as an offering of well-being,
content_old: 8 And if it is an animal from the herd that you offer to the LORD as a burnt offering or as a sacrifice, in fulfillment of a vow explicitly uttered or as an offering of well-being,

content: 9 there shall be offered a meal offering along with the animal: three-tenths of a measure of choice flour with half a hin of oil mixed in;
content_old: 9 there shall be offered a meal offering along with the animal: three-tenths of a measure of choice flour with half a hin of oil mixed in;

content: 10 and as libation you shall offer half a hin of wine—these being offerings by fire of pleasing odor to the LORD.
content_old: 10 and as libation you shall offer half a hin of wine—these being offerings by fire of pleasing odor to the LORD.

content: 11 Thus shall be done with each ox, with each ram, and with any sheep or goat,
content_old: 11 Thus shall be done with each ox, with each ram, and with any sheep or goat,

content: 12 as many as you offer; you shall do thus with each one, as many as there are.
content_old: 12 as many as you offer; you shall do thus with each one, as many as there are.

content: 13 Every citizen, when presenting an offering by fire of pleasing odor to the LORD, shall do so with them.
content_old: 13 Every citizen, when presenting an offering by fire of pleasing odor to the LORD, shall do so with them.

content: 14 And when, throughout the ages, a stranger who has taken up residence with you, or one who lives among you, would present an offering by fire of pleasing odor to the LORD—as you do, so shall it be done by
content_old: 14 And when, throughout the ages, a stranger who has taken up residence with you, or one who lives among you, would present an offering by fire of pleasing odor to the LORD—as you do, so shall it be done by

content: 15 the rest of the congregation. There shall be one law for you and for the resident stranger; it shall be a law for all time throughout the ages. You and the stranger shall be alike before the LORD;
content_old: 15 the rest of the congregation. There shall be one law for you and for the resident stranger; it shall be a law for all time throughout the ages. You and the stranger shall be alike before the LORD;

content: 16 the same ritual and the same rule shall apply to you and to the stranger who resides among you.
content_old: 16 the same ritual and the same rule shall apply to you and to the stranger who resides among you.

content: 17 The LORD spoke to Moses, saying:
content_old: 17 The LORD spoke to Moses, saying:

content: 18 Speak to the Israelite people and say to them: When you enter the land to which I am taking you
content_old: 18 Speak to the Israelite people and say to them: When you enter the land to which I am taking you

content: 19 and you eat of the bread of the land, you shall set some aside as a gift to the LORD:
content_old: 19 and you eat of the bread of the land, you shall set some aside as a gift to the LORD:

content: 20 as the first yield of your baking, you shall set aside a loaf as a gift; you shall set it aside as a gift like the gift from the threshing floor.
content_old: 20 as the first yield of your baking, you shall set aside a loaf as a gift; you shall set it aside as a gift like the gift from the threshing floor.

content: 21 You shall make a gift to the LORD from the first yield of your baking, throughout the ages.
content_old: 21 You shall make a gift to the LORD from the first yield of your baking, throughout the ages.

content: 22 If you unwittingly fail to observe any one of the commandments that the LORD has declared to Moses
content_old: 22 If you unwittingly fail to observe any one of the commandments that the LORD has declared to Moses

content: 23 —anything that the LORD has enjoined upon you through Moses—from the day that the LORD gave the commandment and on through the ages:
content_old: 23 —anything that the LORD has enjoined upon you through Moses—from the day that the LORD gave the commandment and on through the ages:

content: 24 If this was done unwittingly, through the inadvertence of the community, the whole community shall present one bull of the herd as a burnt offering of pleasing odor to the LORD, with its proper meal offering and libation, and one he-goat as a sin offering.
content_old: 24 If this was done unwittingly, through the inadvertence of the community, the whole community shall present one bull of the herd as a burnt offering of pleasing odor to the LORD, with its proper meal offering and libation, and one he-goat as a sin offering.

content: 25 The priest shall make expiation for the whole Israelite community and they shall be forgiven; for it was an error, and for their error they have brought their offering, an offering by fire to the LORD and their sin offering before the LORD.
content_old: 25 The priest shall make expiation for the whole Israelite community and they shall be forgiven; for it was an error, and for their error they have brought their offering, an offering by fire to the LORD and their sin offering before the LORD.

content: 26 The whole Israelite community and the stranger residing among them shall be forgiven, for it happened to the entire people through error.
content_old: 26 The whole Israelite community and the stranger residing among them shall be forgiven, for it happened to the entire people through error.

content: 27 In case it is an individual who has sinned unwittingly, he shall offer a she-goat in its first year as a sin offering.
content_old: 27 In case it is an individual who has sinned unwittingly, he shall offer a she-goat in its first year as a sin offering.

content: 28 The priest shall make expiation before the LORD on behalf of the person who erred, for he sinned unwittingly, making such expiation for him that he may be forgiven.
content_old: 28 The priest shall make expiation before the LORD on behalf of the person who erred, for he sinned unwittingly, making such expiation for him that he may be forgiven.

content: 29 For the citizen among the Israelites and for the stranger who resides among them—you shall have one ritual for anyone who acts in error.
content_old: 29 For the citizen among the Israelites and for the stranger who resides among them—you shall have one ritual for anyone who acts in error.

content: 30 But the person, be he citizen or stranger, who acts defiantly reviles the LORD; that person shall be cut off from among his people.
content_old: 30 But the person, be he citizen or stranger, who acts defiantly reviles the LORD; that person shall be cut off from among his people.

content: 31 Because he has spurned the word of the LORD and violated His commandment, that person shall be cut off—he bears his guilt.
content_old: 31 Because he has spurned the word of the LORD and violated His commandment, that person shall be cut off—he bears his guilt.

content: 32 Once, when the Israelites were in the wilderness, they came upon a man gathering wood on the sabbath day.
content_old: 32 Once, when the Israelites were in the wilderness, they came upon a man gathering wood on the sabbath day.

content: 33 Those who found him as he was gathering wood brought him before Moses, Aaron, and the whole community.
content_old: 33 Those who found him as he was gathering wood brought him before Moses, Aaron, and the whole community.

content: 34 He was placed in custody, for it had not been specified what should be done to him.
content_old: 34 He was placed in custody, for it had not been specified what should be done to him.

content: 35 Then the LORD said to Moses, “The man shall be put to death: the whole community shall pelt him with stones outside the camp.”
content_old: 35 Then the LORD said to Moses, “The man shall be put to death: the whole community shall pelt him with stones outside the camp.”

content: 36 So the whole community took him outside the camp and stoned him to death—as the LORD had commanded Moses.
content_old: 36 So the whole community took him outside the camp and stoned him to death—as the LORD had commanded Moses.

content: 37 The LORD said to Moses as follows:
content_old: 37 The LORD said to Moses as follows:

content: 38 Speak to the Israelite people and instruct them to make for themselves fringes on the corners of their garments throughout the ages; let them attach a cord of blue to the fringe at each corner.
content_old: 38 Speak to the Israelite people and instruct them to make for themselves fringes on the corners of their garments throughout the ages; let them attach a cord of blue to the fringe at each corner.

content: 39 That shall be your fringe; look at it and recall all the commandments of the LORD and observe them, so that you do not follow your heart and eyes in your lustful urge.
content_old: 39 That shall be your fringe; look at it and recall all the commandments of the LORD and observe them, so that you do not follow your heart and eyes in your lustful urge.

content: 40 Thus you shall be reminded to observe all My commandments and to be holy to your God.
content_old: 40 Thus you shall be reminded to observe all My commandments and to be holy to your God.

content: 1 Now Korah, son of Izhar son of Kohath son of Levi, betook himself, along with Dathan and Abiram sons of Eliab, and On son of Peleth—descendants of Reuben—
content_old: 1 Now Korah, son of Izhar son of Kohath son of Levi, betook himself, along with Dathan and Abiram sons of Eliab, and On son of Peleth—descendants of Reuben—

content: 2 to rise up against Moses, together with two hundred and fifty Israelites, chieftains of the community, chosen in the assembly, men of repute.
content_old: 2 to rise up against Moses, together with two hundred and fifty Israelites, chieftains of the community, chosen in the assembly, men of repute.

content: 3 They combined against Moses and Aaron and said to them, “You have gone too far! For all the community are holy, all of them, and the LORD is in their midst. Why then do you raise yourselves above the LORD’s congregation?”
content_old: 3 They combined against Moses and Aaron and said to them, “You have gone too far! For all the community are holy, all of them, and the LORD is in their midst. Why then do you raise yourselves above the LORD’s congregation?”

content: 4 When Moses heard this, he fell on his face.
content_old: 4 When Moses heard this, he fell on his face.

content: 5 Then he spoke to Korah and all his company, saying, “Come morning, the LORD will make known who is His and who is holy, and will grant him access to Himself; He will grant access to the one He has chosen.
content_old: 5 Then he spoke to Korah and all his company, saying, “Come morning, the LORD will make known who is His and who is holy, and will grant him access to Himself; He will grant access to the one He has chosen.

content: 6 Do this: You, Korah and all your band, take fire pans,
content_old: 6 Do this: You, Korah and all your band, take fire pans,

content: 7 and tomorrow put fire in them and lay incense on them before the LORD. Then the man whom the LORD chooses, he shall be the holy one. You have gone too far, sons of Levi!”
content_old: 7 and tomorrow put fire in them and lay incense on them before the LORD. Then the man whom the LORD chooses, he shall be the holy one. You have gone too far, sons of Levi!”

content: 8 Moses said further to Korah, “Hear me, sons of Levi.
content_old: 8 Moses said further to Korah, “Hear me, sons of Levi.

content: 9 Is it not enough for you that the God of Israel has set you apart from the community of Israel and given you access to Him, to perform the duties of the LORD’s Tabernacle and to minister to the community and serve them?
content_old: 9 Is it not enough for you that the God of Israel has set you apart from the community of Israel and given you access to Him, to perform the duties of the LORD’s Tabernacle and to minister to the community and serve them?

content: 10 Now that He has advanced you and all your fellow Levites with you, do you seek the priesthood too?
content_old: 10 Now that He has advanced you and all your fellow Levites with you, do you seek the priesthood too?

content: 11 Truly, it is against the LORD that you and all your company have banded together. For who is Aaron that you should rail against him?”
content_old: 11 Truly, it is against the LORD that you and all your company have banded together. For who is Aaron that you should rail against him?”

content: 12 Moses sent for Dathan and Abiram, sons of Eliab; but they said, “We will not come!
content_old: 12 Moses sent for Dathan and Abiram, sons of Eliab; but they said, “We will not come!

content: 13 Is it not enough that you brought us from a land flowing with milk and honey to have us die in the wilderness, that you would also lord it over us?
content_old: 13 Is it not enough that you brought us from a land flowing with milk and honey to have us die in the wilderness, that you would also lord it over us?

content: 14 Even if you had brought us to a land flowing with milk and honey, and given us possession of fields and vineyards, should you gouge out those men’s eyes? We will not come!”
content_old: 14 Even if you had brought us to a land flowing with milk and honey, and given us possession of fields and vineyards, should you gouge out those men’s eyes? We will not come!”

content: 15 Moses was much aggrieved and he said to the LORD, “Pay no regard to their oblation. I have not taken the ass of any one of them, nor have I wronged any one of them.”
content_old: 15 Moses was much aggrieved and he said to the LORD, “Pay no regard to their oblation. I have not taken the ass of any one of them, nor have I wronged any one of them.”

content: 16 And Moses said to Korah, “Tomorrow, you and all your company appear before the LORD, you and they and Aaron.
content_old: 16 And Moses said to Korah, “Tomorrow, you and all your company appear before the LORD, you and they and Aaron.

content: 17 Each of you take his fire pan and lay incense on it, and each of you bring his fire pan before the LORD, two hundred and fifty fire pans; you and Aaron also bring your fire pans.”
content_old: 17 Each of you take his fire pan and lay incense on it, and each of you bring his fire pan before the LORD, two hundred and fifty fire pans; you and Aaron also bring your fire pans.”

content: 18 Each of them took his fire pan, put fire in it, laid incense on it, and took his place at the entrance of the Tent of Meeting, as did Moses and Aaron.
content_old: 18 Each of them took his fire pan, put fire in it, laid incense on it, and took his place at the entrance of the Tent of Meeting, as did Moses and Aaron.

content: 19 Korah gathered the whole community against them at the entrance of the Tent of Meeting. Then the Presence of the LORD appeared to the whole community,
content_old: 19 Korah gathered the whole community against them at the entrance of the Tent of Meeting. Then the Presence of the LORD appeared to the whole community,

content: 20 and the LORD spoke to Moses and Aaron, saying,
content_old: 20 and the LORD spoke to Moses and Aaron, saying,

content: 21 “Stand back from this community that I may annihilate them in an instant!”
content_old: 21 “Stand back from this community that I may annihilate them in an instant!”

content: 22 But they fell on their faces and said, “O God, Source of the breath of all flesh! When one man sins, will You be wrathful with the whole community?”
content_old: 22 But they fell on their faces and said, “O God, Source of the breath of all flesh! When one man sins, will You be wrathful with the whole community?”

content: 23 The LORD spoke to Moses, saying,
content_old: 23 The LORD spoke to Moses, saying,

content: 24 “Speak to the community and say: Withdraw from about the abodes of Korah, Dathan, and Abiram.”
content_old: 24 “Speak to the community and say: Withdraw from about the abodes of Korah, Dathan, and Abiram.”

content: 25 Moses rose and went to Dathan and Abiram, the elders of Israel following him.
content_old: 25 Moses rose and went to Dathan and Abiram, the elders of Israel following him.

content: 26 He addressed the community, saying, “Move away from the tents of these wicked men and touch nothing that belongs to them, lest you be wiped out for all their sins.”
content_old: 26 He addressed the community, saying, “Move away from the tents of these wicked men and touch nothing that belongs to them, lest you be wiped out for all their sins.”

content: 27 So they withdrew from about the abodes of Korah, Dathan, and Abiram. Now Dathan and Abiram had come out and they stood at the entrance of their tents, with their wives, their children, and their little ones.
content_old: 27 So they withdrew from about the abodes of Korah, Dathan, and Abiram. Now Dathan and Abiram had come out and they stood at the entrance of their tents, with their wives, their children, and their little ones.

content: 28 And Moses said, “By this you shall know that it was the LORD who sent me to do all these things; that they are not of my own devising:
content_old: 28 And Moses said, “By this you shall know that it was the LORD who sent me to do all these things; that they are not of my own devising:

content: 29 if these men die as all men do, if their lot be the common fate of all mankind, it was not the LORD who sent me.
content_old: 29 if these men die as all men do, if their lot be the common fate of all mankind, it was not the LORD who sent me.

content: 30 But if the LORD brings about something unheard-of, so that the ground opens its mouth and swallows them up with all that belongs to them, and they go down alive into Sheol, you shall know that these men have spurned the LORD.”
content_old: 30 But if the LORD brings about something unheard-of, so that the ground opens its mouth and swallows them up with all that belongs to them, and they go down alive into Sheol, you shall know that these men have spurned the LORD.”

content: 31 Scarcely had he finished speaking all these words when the ground under them burst asunder,
content_old: 31 Scarcely had he finished speaking all these words when the ground under them burst asunder,

content: 32 and the earth opened its mouth and swallowed them up with their households, all Korah’s people and all their possessions.
content_old: 32 and the earth opened its mouth and swallowed them up with their households, all Korah’s people and all their possessions.

content: 33 They went down alive into Sheol, with all that belonged to them; the earth closed over them and they vanished from the midst of the congregation.
content_old: 33 They went down alive into Sheol, with all that belonged to them; the earth closed over them and they vanished from the midst of the congregation.

content: 34 All Israel around them fled at their shrieks, for they said, “The earth might swallow us!”
content_old: 34 All Israel around them fled at their shrieks, for they said, “The earth might swallow us!”

content: 1 The LORD spoke to Moses, saying:
content_old: 1 The LORD spoke to Moses, saying:

content: 2 Order Eleazar son of Aaron the priest to remove the fire pans—for they have become sacred—from among the charred remains; and scatter the coals abroad.
content_old: 2 Order Eleazar son of Aaron the priest to remove the fire pans—for they have become sacred—from among the charred remains; and scatter the coals abroad.

content: 3 the fire pans of those who have sinned at the cost of their lives, and let them be made into hammered sheets as plating for the altar—for once they have been used for offering to the LORD, they have become sacred—and let them serve as a warning to the people of Israel.
content_old: 3 the fire pans of those who have sinned at the cost of their lives, and let them be made into hammered sheets as plating for the altar—for once they have been used for offering to the LORD, they have become sacred—and let them serve as a warning to the people of Israel.

content: 4 Eleazar the priest took the copper fire pans which had been used for offering by those who died in the fire; and they were hammered into plating for the altar,
content_old: 4 Eleazar the priest took the copper fire pans which had been used for offering by those who died in the fire; and they were hammered into plating for the altar,

content: 5 as the LORD had ordered him through Moses. It was to be a reminder to the Israelites, so that no outsider—one not of Aaron’s offspring—should presume to offer incense before the LORD and suffer the fate of Korah and his band.
content_old: 5 as the LORD had ordered him through Moses. It was to be a reminder to the Israelites, so that no outsider—one not of Aaron’s offspring—should presume to offer incense before the LORD and suffer the fate of Korah and his band.

content: 6 Next day the whole Israelite community railed against Moses and Aaron, saying, “You two have brought death upon the LORD’s people!”
content_old: 6 Next day the whole Israelite community railed against Moses and Aaron, saying, “You two have brought death upon the LORD’s people!”

content: 7 But as the community gathered against them, Moses and Aaron turned toward the Tent of Meeting; the cloud had covered it and the Presence of the LORD appeared.
content_old: 7 But as the community gathered against them, Moses and Aaron turned toward the Tent of Meeting; the cloud had covered it and the Presence of the LORD appeared.

content: 8 When Moses and Aaron reached the Tent of Meeting,
content_old: 8 When Moses and Aaron reached the Tent of Meeting,

content: 9 the LORD spoke to Moses, saying,
content_old: 9 the LORD spoke to Moses, saying,

content: 10 “Remove yourselves from this community, that I may annihilate them in an instant.” They fell on their faces.
content_old: 10 “Remove yourselves from this community, that I may annihilate them in an instant.” They fell on their faces.

content: 11 Then Moses said to Aaron, “Take the fire pan, and put on it fire from the altar. Add incense and take it quickly to the community and make expiation for them. For wrath has gone forth from the LORD: the plague has begun!”
content_old: 11 Then Moses said to Aaron, “Take the fire pan, and put on it fire from the altar. Add incense and take it quickly to the community and make expiation for them. For wrath has gone forth from the LORD: the plague has begun!”

content: 12 Aaron took it, as Moses had ordered, and ran to the midst of the congregation, where the plague had begun among the people. He put on the incense and made expiation for the people;
content_old: 12 Aaron took it, as Moses had ordered, and ran to the midst of the congregation, where the plague had begun among the people. He put on the incense and made expiation for the people;

content: 13 he stood between the dead and the living until the plague was checked.
content_old: 13 he stood between the dead and the living until the plague was checked.

content: 14 Those who died of the plague came to fourteen thousand and seven hundred, aside from those who died on account of Korah.
content_old: 14 Those who died of the plague came to fourteen thousand and seven hundred, aside from those who died on account of Korah.

content: 15 Aaron then returned to Moses at the entrance of the Tent of Meeting, since the plague was checked.
content_old: 15 Aaron then returned to Moses at the entrance of the Tent of Meeting, since the plague was checked.

content: 16 The LORD spoke to Moses, saying:
content_old: 16 The LORD spoke to Moses, saying:

content: 17 Speak to the Israelite people and take from them—from the chieftains of their ancestral houses—one staff for each chieftain of an ancestral house: twelve staffs in all. Inscribe each man’s name on his staff,
content_old: 17 Speak to the Israelite people and take from them—from the chieftains of their ancestral houses—one staff for each chieftain of an ancestral house: twelve staffs in all. Inscribe each man’s name on his staff,

content: 18 there being one staff for each head of an ancestral house; also inscribe Aaron’s name on the staff of Levi.
content_old: 18 there being one staff for each head of an ancestral house; also inscribe Aaron’s name on the staff of Levi.

content: 19 Deposit them in the Tent of Meeting before the Pact, where I meet with you.
content_old: 19 Deposit them in the Tent of Meeting before the Pact, where I meet with you.

content: 20 The staff of the man whom I choose shall sprout, and I will rid Myself of the incessant mutterings of the Israelites against you.
content_old: 20 The staff of the man whom I choose shall sprout, and I will rid Myself of the incessant mutterings of the Israelites against you.

content: 21 Moses spoke thus to the Israelites. Their chieftains gave him a staff for each chieftain of an ancestral house, twelve staffs in all; among these staffs was that of Aaron.
content_old: 21 Moses spoke thus to the Israelites. Their chieftains gave him a staff for each chieftain of an ancestral house, twelve staffs in all; among these staffs was that of Aaron.

content: 22 Moses deposited the staffs before the LORD, in the Tent of the Pact.
content_old: 22 Moses deposited the staffs before the LORD, in the Tent of the Pact.

content: 23 The next day Moses entered the Tent of the Pact, and there the staff of Aaron of the house of Levi had sprouted: it had brought forth sprouts, produced blossoms, and borne almonds.
content_old: 23 The next day Moses entered the Tent of the Pact, and there the staff of Aaron of the house of Levi had sprouted: it had brought forth sprouts, produced blossoms, and borne almonds.

content: 24 Moses then brought out all the staffs from before the LORD to all the Israelites; each identified and recovered his staff.
content_old: 24 Moses then brought out all the staffs from before the LORD to all the Israelites; each identified and recovered his staff.

content: 25 The LORD said to Moses, “Put Aaron’s staff back before the Pact, to be kept as a lesson to rebels, so that their mutterings against Me may cease, lest they die.”
content_old: 25 The LORD said to Moses, “Put Aaron’s staff back before the Pact, to be kept as a lesson to rebels, so that their mutterings against Me may cease, lest they die.”

content: 26 This Moses did; just as the LORD had commanded him, so he did.
content_old: 26 This Moses did; just as the LORD had commanded him, so he did.

content: 27 But the Israelites said to Moses, “Lo, we perish! We are lost, all of us lost!
content_old: 27 But the Israelites said to Moses, “Lo, we perish! We are lost, all of us lost!

content: 1 The LORD said to Aaron: You and your sons and the ancestral house under your charge shall bear any guilt connected with the sanctuary; you and your sons alone shall bear any guilt connected with your priesthood.
content_old: 1 The LORD said to Aaron: You and your sons and the ancestral house under your charge shall bear any guilt connected with the sanctuary; you and your sons alone shall bear any guilt connected with your priesthood.

content: 2 You shall also associate with yourself your kinsmen the tribe of Levi, your ancestral tribe, to be attached to you and to minister to you, while you and your sons under your charge are before the Tent of the Pact.
content_old: 2 You shall also associate with yourself your kinsmen the tribe of Levi, your ancestral tribe, to be attached to you and to minister to you, while you and your sons under your charge are before the Tent of the Pact.

content: 3 They shall discharge their duties to you and to the Tent as a whole, but they must not have any contact with the furnishings of the Shrine or with the altar, lest both they and you die.
content_old: 3 They shall discharge their duties to you and to the Tent as a whole, but they must not have any contact with the furnishings of the Shrine or with the altar, lest both they and you die.

content: 4 They shall be attached to you and discharge the duties of the Tent of Meeting, all the service of the Tent; but no outsider shall intrude upon you
content_old: 4 They shall be attached to you and discharge the duties of the Tent of Meeting, all the service of the Tent; but no outsider shall intrude upon you

content: 5 as you discharge the duties connected with the Shrine and the altar, that wrath may not again strike the Israelites.
content_old: 5 as you discharge the duties connected with the Shrine and the altar, that wrath may not again strike the Israelites.

content: 6 I hereby take your fellow Levites from among the Israelites; they are assigned to you in dedication to the LORD, to do the work of the Tent of Meeting;
content_old: 6 I hereby take your fellow Levites from among the Israelites; they are assigned to you in dedication to the LORD, to do the work of the Tent of Meeting;

content: 7 while you and your sons shall be careful to perform your priestly duties in everything pertaining to the altar and to what is behind the curtain. I make your priesthood a service of dedication; any outsider who encroaches shall be put to death.
content_old: 7 while you and your sons shall be careful to perform your priestly duties in everything pertaining to the altar and to what is behind the curtain. I make your priesthood a service of dedication; any outsider who encroaches shall be put to death.

content: 8 The LORD spoke further to Aaron: I hereby give you charge of My gifts, all the sacred donations of the Israelites; I grant them to you and to your sons as a perquisite, a due for all time.
content_old: 8 The LORD spoke further to Aaron: I hereby give you charge of My gifts, all the sacred donations of the Israelites; I grant them to you and to your sons as a perquisite, a due for all time.

content: 9 This shall be yours from the most holy sacrifices, the offerings by fire: every such offering that they render to Me as most holy sacrifices, namely, every meal offering, sin offering, and guilt offering of theirs, shall belong to you and your sons.
content_old: 9 This shall be yours from the most holy sacrifices, the offerings by fire: every such offering that they render to Me as most holy sacrifices, namely, every meal offering, sin offering, and guilt offering of theirs, shall belong to you and your sons.

content: 10 You shall partake of them as most sacred donations: only males may eat them; you shall treat them as consecrated.
content_old: 10 You shall partake of them as most sacred donations: only males may eat them; you shall treat them as consecrated.

content: 11 This, too, shall be yours: the gift offerings of their contributions, all the elevation offerings of the Israelites, I give to you, to your sons, and to the daughters that are with you, as a due for all time; everyone of your household who is clean may eat it.
content_old: 11 This, too, shall be yours: the gift offerings of their contributions, all the elevation offerings of the Israelites, I give to you, to your sons, and to the daughters that are with you, as a due for all time; everyone of your household who is clean may eat it.

content: 12 All the best of the new oil, wine, and grain—the choice parts that they present to the LORD—I give to you.
content_old: 12 All the best of the new oil, wine, and grain—the choice parts that they present to the LORD—I give to you.

content: 13 The first fruits of everything in their land, that they bring to the LORD, shall be yours; everyone of your household who is clean may eat them.
content_old: 13 The first fruits of everything in their land, that they bring to the LORD, shall be yours; everyone of your household who is clean may eat them.

content: 14 Everything that has been proscribed in Israel shall be yours.
content_old: 14 Everything that has been proscribed in Israel shall be yours.

content: 15 The first issue of the womb of every being, man or beast, that is offered to the LORD, shall be yours; but you shall have the first-born of man redeemed, and you shall also have the firstling of unclean animals redeemed.
content_old: 15 The first issue of the womb of every being, man or beast, that is offered to the LORD, shall be yours; but you shall have the first-born of man redeemed, and you shall also have the firstling of unclean animals redeemed.

content: 16 Take as their redemption price, from the age of one month up, the money equivalent of five shekels by the sanctuary weight, which is twenty gerahs.
content_old: 16 Take as their redemption price, from the age of one month up, the money equivalent of five shekels by the sanctuary weight, which is twenty gerahs.

content: 17 But the firstlings of cattle, sheep, or goats may not be redeemed; they are consecrated. You shall dash their blood against the altar, and turn their fat into smoke as an offering by fire for a pleasing odor to the LORD.
content_old: 17 But the firstlings of cattle, sheep, or goats may not be redeemed; they are consecrated. You shall dash their blood against the altar, and turn their fat into smoke as an offering by fire for a pleasing odor to the LORD.

content: 18 But their meat shall be yours: it shall be yours like the breast of elevation offering and like the right thigh.
content_old: 18 But their meat shall be yours: it shall be yours like the breast of elevation offering and like the right thigh.

content: 19 All the sacred gifts that the Israelites set aside for the LORD I give to you, to your sons, and to the daughters that are with you, as a due for all time. It shall be an everlasting covenant of salt before the LORD for you and for your offspring as well.
content_old: 19 All the sacred gifts that the Israelites set aside for the LORD I give to you, to your sons, and to the daughters that are with you, as a due for all time. It shall be an everlasting covenant of salt before the LORD for you and for your offspring as well.

content: 20 And the LORD said to Aaron: You shall, however, have no territorial share among them or own any portion in their midst; I am your portion and your share among the Israelites.
content_old: 20 And the LORD said to Aaron: You shall, however, have no territorial share among them or own any portion in their midst; I am your portion and your share among the Israelites.

content: 21 And to the Levites I hereby give all the tithes in Israel as their share in return for the services that they perform, the services of the Tent of Meeting.
content_old: 21 And to the Levites I hereby give all the tithes in Israel as their share in return for the services that they perform, the services of the Tent of Meeting.

content: 22 Henceforth, Israelites shall not trespass on the Tent of Meeting, and thus incur guilt and die:
content_old: 22 Henceforth, Israelites shall not trespass on the Tent of Meeting, and thus incur guilt and die:

content: 23 only Levites shall perform the services of the Tent of Meeting; others would incur guilt. It is the law for all time throughout the ages. But they shall have no territorial share among the Israelites;
content_old: 23 only Levites shall perform the services of the Tent of Meeting; others would incur guilt. It is the law for all time throughout the ages. But they shall have no territorial share among the Israelites;

content: 24 for it is the tithes set aside by the Israelites as a gift to the LORD that I give to the Levites as their share. Therefore I have said concerning them: They shall have no territorial share among the Israelites.
content_old: 24 for it is the tithes set aside by the Israelites as a gift to the LORD that I give to the Levites as their share. Therefore I have said concerning them: They shall have no territorial share among the Israelites.

content: 25 The LORD spoke to Moses, saying:
content_old: 25 The LORD spoke to Moses, saying:

content: 26 Speak to the Levites and say to them: When you receive from the Israelites their tithes, which I have assigned to you as your share, you shall set aside from them one-tenth of the tithe as a gift to the LORD.
content_old: 26 Speak to the Levites and say to them: When you receive from the Israelites their tithes, which I have assigned to you as your share, you shall set aside from them one-tenth of the tithe as a gift to the LORD.

content: 27 This shall be accounted to you as your gift. As with the new grain from the threshing floor or the flow from the vat,
content_old: 27 This shall be accounted to you as your gift. As with the new grain from the threshing floor or the flow from the vat,

content: 28 so shall you on your part set aside a gift for the LORD from all the tithes that you receive from the Israelites; and from them you shall bring the gift for the LORD to Aaron the priest.
content_old: 28 so shall you on your part set aside a gift for the LORD from all the tithes that you receive from the Israelites; and from them you shall bring the gift for the LORD to Aaron the priest.

content: 29 You shall set aside all gifts due to the LORD from everything that is donated to you, from each thing its best portion, the part thereof that is to be consecrated.
content_old: 29 You shall set aside all gifts due to the LORD from everything that is donated to you, from each thing its best portion, the part thereof that is to be consecrated.

content: 30 Say to them further: When you have removed the best part from it, you Levites may consider it the same as the yield of threshing floor or vat.
content_old: 30 Say to them further: When you have removed the best part from it, you Levites may consider it the same as the yield of threshing floor or vat.

content: 31 You and your households may eat it anywhere, for it is your recompense for your services in the Tent of Meeting.
content_old: 31 You and your households may eat it anywhere, for it is your recompense for your services in the Tent of Meeting.

content: 1 The LORD spoke to Moses and Aaron, saying:
content_old: 1 The LORD spoke to Moses and Aaron, saying:

content: 2 This is the ritual law that the LORD has commanded: Instruct the Israelite people to bring you a red cow without blemish, in which there is no defect and on which no yoke has been laid.
content_old: 2 This is the ritual law that the LORD has commanded: Instruct the Israelite people to bring you a red cow without blemish, in which there is no defect and on which no yoke has been laid.

content: 3 You shall give it to Eleazar the priest. It shall be taken outside the camp and slaughtered in his presence.
content_old: 3 You shall give it to Eleazar the priest. It shall be taken outside the camp and slaughtered in his presence.

content: 4 Eleazar the priest shall take some of its blood with his finger and sprinkle it seven times toward the front of the Tent of Meeting.
content_old: 4 Eleazar the priest shall take some of its blood with his finger and sprinkle it seven times toward the front of the Tent of Meeting.

content: 5 The cow shall be burned in his sight—its hide, flesh, and blood shall be burned, its dung included—
content_old: 5 The cow shall be burned in his sight—its hide, flesh, and blood shall be burned, its dung included—

content: 6 and the priest shall take cedar wood, hyssop, and crimson stuff, and throw them into the fire consuming the cow.
content_old: 6 and the priest shall take cedar wood, hyssop, and crimson stuff, and throw them into the fire consuming the cow.

content: 7 The priest shall wash his garments and bathe his body in water; after that the priest may reenter the camp, but he shall be unclean until evening.
content_old: 7 The priest shall wash his garments and bathe his body in water; after that the priest may reenter the camp, but he shall be unclean until evening.

content: 8 He who performed the burning shall also wash his garments in water, bathe his body in water, and be unclean until evening.
content_old: 8 He who performed the burning shall also wash his garments in water, bathe his body in water, and be unclean until evening.

content: 9 A man who is clean shall gather up the ashes of the cow and deposit them outside the camp in a clean place, to be kept for water of lustration for the Israelite community. It is for cleansing.
content_old: 9 A man who is clean shall gather up the ashes of the cow and deposit them outside the camp in a clean place, to be kept for water of lustration for the Israelite community. It is for cleansing.

content: 10 He who gathers up the ashes of the cow shall also wash his clothes and be unclean until evening. This shall be a permanent law for the Israelites and for the strangers who reside among you.
content_old: 10 He who gathers up the ashes of the cow shall also wash his clothes and be unclean until evening. This shall be a permanent law for the Israelites and for the strangers who reside among you.

content: 11 He who touches the corpse of any human being shall be unclean for seven days.
content_old: 11 He who touches the corpse of any human being shall be unclean for seven days.

content: 12 He shall cleanse himself with it on the third day and on the seventh day, and then be clean; if he fails to cleanse himself on the third and seventh days, he shall not be clean.
content_old: 12 He shall cleanse himself with it on the third day and on the seventh day, and then be clean; if he fails to cleanse himself on the third and seventh days, he shall not be clean.

content: 13 Whoever touches a corpse, the body of a person who has died, and does not cleanse himself, defiles the LORD’s Tabernacle; that person shall be cut off from Israel. Since the water of lustration was not dashed on him, he remains unclean; his uncleanness is still upon him.
content_old: 13 Whoever touches a corpse, the body of a person who has died, and does not cleanse himself, defiles the LORD’s Tabernacle; that person shall be cut off from Israel. Since the water of lustration was not dashed on him, he remains unclean; his uncleanness is still upon him.

content: 14 This is the ritual: When a person dies in a tent, whoever enters the tent and whoever is in the tent shall be unclean seven days;
content_old: 14 This is the ritual: When a person dies in a tent, whoever enters the tent and whoever is in the tent shall be unclean seven days;

content: 15 and every open vessel, with no lid fastened down, shall be unclean.
content_old: 15 and every open vessel, with no lid fastened down, shall be unclean.

content: 16 And in the open, anyone who touches a person who was killed or who died naturally, or human bone, or a grave, shall be unclean seven days.
content_old: 16 And in the open, anyone who touches a person who was killed or who died naturally, or human bone, or a grave, shall be unclean seven days.

content: 17 Some of the ashes from the fire of cleansing shall be taken for the unclean person, and fresh water shall be added to them in a vessel.
content_old: 17 Some of the ashes from the fire of cleansing shall be taken for the unclean person, and fresh water shall be added to them in a vessel.

content: 18 A person who is clean shall take hyssop, dip it in the water, and sprinkle on the tent and on all the vessels and people who were there, or on him who touched the bones or the person who was killed or died naturally or the grave.
content_old: 18 A person who is clean shall take hyssop, dip it in the water, and sprinkle on the tent and on all the vessels and people who were there, or on him who touched the bones or the person who was killed or died naturally or the grave.

content: 19 The clean person shall sprinkle it upon the unclean person on the third day and on the seventh day, thus cleansing him by the seventh day. He shall then wash his clothes and bathe in water, and at nightfall he shall be clean.
content_old: 19 The clean person shall sprinkle it upon the unclean person on the third day and on the seventh day, thus cleansing him by the seventh day. He shall then wash his clothes and bathe in water, and at nightfall he shall be clean.

content: 20 If anyone who has become unclean fails to cleanse himself, that person shall be cut off from the congregation, for he has defiled the LORD’s sanctuary. The water of lustration was not dashed on him: he is unclean.
content_old: 20 If anyone who has become unclean fails to cleanse himself, that person shall be cut off from the congregation, for he has defiled the LORD’s sanctuary. The water of lustration was not dashed on him: he is unclean.

content: 21 That shall be for them a law for all time. Further, he who sprinkled the water of lustration shall wash his clothes; and whoever touches the water of lustration shall be unclean until evening.
content_old: 21 That shall be for them a law for all time. Further, he who sprinkled the water of lustration shall wash his clothes; and whoever touches the water of lustration shall be unclean until evening.

content: 1 The Israelites arrived in a body at the wilderness of Zin on the first new moon, and the people stayed at Kadesh. Miriam died there and was buried there.
content_old: 1 The Israelites arrived in a body at the wilderness of Zin on the first new moon, and the people stayed at Kadesh. Miriam died there and was buried there.

content: 2 The community was without water, and they joined against Moses and Aaron.
content_old: 2 The community was without water, and they joined against Moses and Aaron.

content: 3 The people quarreled with Moses, saying, “If only we had perished when our brothers perished at the instance of the LORD!
content_old: 3 The people quarreled with Moses, saying, “If only we had perished when our brothers perished at the instance of the LORD!

content: 4 Why have you brought the LORD’s congregation into this wilderness for us and our beasts to die there?
content_old: 4 Why have you brought the LORD’s congregation into this wilderness for us and our beasts to die there?

content: 5 Why did you make us leave Egypt to bring us to this wretched place, a place with no grain or figs or vines or pomegranates? There is not even water to drink!”
content_old: 5 Why did you make us leave Egypt to bring us to this wretched place, a place with no grain or figs or vines or pomegranates? There is not even water to drink!”

content: 6 Moses and Aaron came away from the congregation to the entrance of the Tent of Meeting, and fell on their faces. The Presence of the LORD appeared to them,
content_old: 6 Moses and Aaron came away from the congregation to the entrance of the Tent of Meeting, and fell on their faces. The Presence of the LORD appeared to them,

content: 7 and the LORD spoke to Moses, saying,
content_old: 7 and the LORD spoke to Moses, saying,

content: 8 “You and your brother Aaron take the rod and assemble the community, and before their very eyes order the rock to yield its water. Thus you shall produce water for them from the rock and provide drink for the congregation and their beasts.”
content_old: 8 “You and your brother Aaron take the rod and assemble the community, and before their very eyes order the rock to yield its water. Thus you shall produce water for them from the rock and provide drink for the congregation and their beasts.”

content: 9 Moses took the rod from before the LORD, as He had commanded him.
content_old: 9 Moses took the rod from before the LORD, as He had commanded him.

content: 10 Moses and Aaron assembled the congregation in front of the rock; and he said to them, “Listen, you rebels, shall we get water for you out of this rock?”
content_old: 10 Moses and Aaron assembled the congregation in front of the rock; and he said to them, “Listen, you rebels, shall we get water for you out of this rock?”

content: 11 And Moses raised his hand and struck the rock twice with his rod. Out came copious water, and the community and their beasts drank.
content_old: 11 And Moses raised his hand and struck the rock twice with his rod. Out came copious water, and the community and their beasts drank.

content: 12 But the LORD said to Moses and Aaron, “Because you did not trust Me enough to affirm My sanctity in the sight of the Israelite people, therefore you shall not lead this congregation into the land that I have given them.”
content_old: 12 But the LORD said to Moses and Aaron, “Because you did not trust Me enough to affirm My sanctity in the sight of the Israelite people, therefore you shall not lead this congregation into the land that I have given them.”

content: 13 Those are the Waters of Meribah—meaning that the Israelites quarrelled with the LORD—through which He affirmed His sanctity.
content_old: 13 Those are the Waters of Meribah—meaning that the Israelites quarrelled with the LORD—through which He affirmed His sanctity.

content: 14 From Kadesh, Moses sent messengers to the king of Edom: “Thus says your brother Israel: You know all the hardships that have befallen us;
content_old: 14 From Kadesh, Moses sent messengers to the king of Edom: “Thus says your brother Israel: You know all the hardships that have befallen us;

content: 15 that our ancestors went down to Egypt, that we dwelt in Egypt a long time, and that the Egyptians dealt harshly with us and our ancestors.
content_old: 15 that our ancestors went down to Egypt, that we dwelt in Egypt a long time, and that the Egyptians dealt harshly with us and our ancestors.

content: 16 We cried to the LORD and He heard our plea, and He sent a messenger who freed us from Egypt. Now we are in Kadesh, the town on the border of your territory.
content_old: 16 We cried to the LORD and He heard our plea, and He sent a messenger who freed us from Egypt. Now we are in Kadesh, the town on the border of your territory.

content: 17 Allow us, then, to cross your country. We will not pass through fields or vineyards, and we will not drink water from wells. We will follow the king’s highway, turning off neither to the right nor to the left until we have crossed your territory.”
content_old: 17 Allow us, then, to cross your country. We will not pass through fields or vineyards, and we will not drink water from wells. We will follow the king’s highway, turning off neither to the right nor to the left until we have crossed your territory.”

content: 18 But Edom answered him, “You shall not pass through us, else we will go out against you with the sword.”
content_old: 18 But Edom answered him, “You shall not pass through us, else we will go out against you with the sword.”

content: 19 “We will keep to the beaten track,” the Israelites said to them, “and if we or our cattle drink your water, we will pay for it. We ask only for passage on foot—it is but a small matter.”
content_old: 19 “We will keep to the beaten track,” the Israelites said to them, “and if we or our cattle drink your water, we will pay for it. We ask only for passage on foot—it is but a small matter.”

content: 20 But they replied, “You shall not pass through!” And Edom went out against them in heavy force, strongly armed.
content_old: 20 But they replied, “You shall not pass through!” And Edom went out against them in heavy force, strongly armed.

content: 21 So Edom would not let Israel cross their territory, and Israel turned away from them.
content_old: 21 So Edom would not let Israel cross their territory, and Israel turned away from them.

content: 22 Setting out from Kadesh, the Israelites arrived in a body at Mount Hor.
content_old: 22 Setting out from Kadesh, the Israelites arrived in a body at Mount Hor.

content: 23 At Mount Hor, on the boundary of the land of Edom, the LORD said to Moses and Aaron,
content_old: 23 At Mount Hor, on the boundary of the land of Edom, the LORD said to Moses and Aaron,

content: 24 “Let Aaron be gathered to his kin: he is not to enter the land that I have assigned to the Israelite people, because you disobeyed my command about the waters of Meribah.
content_old: 24 “Let Aaron be gathered to his kin: he is not to enter the land that I have assigned to the Israelite people, because you disobeyed my command about the waters of Meribah.

content: 25 Take Aaron and his son Eleazar and bring them up on Mount Hor.
content_old: 25 Take Aaron and his son Eleazar and bring them up on Mount Hor.

content: 26 Strip Aaron of his vestments and put them on his son Eleazar. There Aaron shall be gathered unto the dead.”
content_old: 26 Strip Aaron of his vestments and put them on his son Eleazar. There Aaron shall be gathered unto the dead.”

content: 27 Moses did as the LORD had commanded. They ascended Mount Hor in the sight of the whole community.
content_old: 27 Moses did as the LORD had commanded. They ascended Mount Hor in the sight of the whole community.

content: 28 Moses stripped Aaron of his vestments and put them on his son Eleazar, and Aaron died there on the summit of the mountain. When Moses and Eleazar came down from the mountain,

content: 1 When the Canaanite, king of Arad, who dwelt in the Negeb, learned that Israel was coming by the way of Atharim, he engaged Israel in battle and took some of them captive.
content_old: 1 When the Canaanite, king of Arad, who dwelt in the Negeb, learned that Israel was coming by the way of Atharim, he engaged Israel in battle and took some of them captive.

content: 2 Then Israel made a vow to the LORD and said, “If You deliver this people into our hand, we will proscribe their towns.”
content_old: 2 Then Israel made a vow to the LORD and said, “If You deliver this people into our hand, we will proscribe their towns.”

content: 3 The LORD heeded Israel’s plea and delivered up the Canaanites; and they and their cities were proscribed. So that place was named Hormah.
content_old: 3 The LORD heeded Israel’s plea and delivered up the Canaanites; and they and their cities were proscribed. So that place was named Hormah.

content: 4 They set out from Mount Hor by way of the Sea of Reeds to skirt the land of Edom. But the people grew restive on the journey,
content_old: 4 They set out from Mount Hor by way of the Sea of Reeds to skirt the land of Edom. But the people grew restive on the journey,

content: 5 and the people spoke against God and against Moses, “Why did you make us leave Egypt to die in the wilderness? There is no bread and no water, and we have come to loathe this miserable food.”
content_old: 5 and the people spoke against God and against Moses, “Why did you make us leave Egypt to die in the wilderness? There is no bread and no water, and we have come to loathe this miserable food.”

content: 6 The LORD sent seraph serpents against the people. They bit the people and many of the Israelites died.
content_old: 6 The LORD sent seraph serpents against the people. They bit the people and many of the Israelites died.

content: 7 The people came to Moses and said, “We sinned by speaking against the LORD and against you. Intercede with the LORD to take away the serpents from us!” And Moses interceded for the people.
content_old: 7 The people came to Moses and said, “We sinned by speaking against the LORD and against you. Intercede with the LORD to take away the serpents from us!” And Moses interceded for the people.

content: 8 Then the LORD said to Moses, “Make a seraph figure and mount it on a standard. And if anyone who is bitten looks at it, he shall recover.”
content_old: 8 Then the LORD said to Moses, “Make a seraph figure and mount it on a standard. And if anyone who is bitten looks at it, he shall recover.”

content: 9 Moses made a copper serpent and mounted it on a standard; and when anyone was bitten by a serpent, he would look at the copper serpent and recover.
content_old: 9 Moses made a copper serpent and mounted it on a standard; and when anyone was bitten by a serpent, he would look at the copper serpent and recover.

content: 10 The Israelites marched on and encamped at Oboth.
content_old: 10 The Israelites marched on and encamped at Oboth.

content: 11 They set out from Oboth and encamped at Iye-abarim, in the wilderness bordering on Moab to the east.
content_old: 11 They set out from Oboth and encamped at Iye-abarim, in the wilderness bordering on Moab to the east.

content: 12 From there they set out and encamped at the wadi Zered.
content_old: 12 From there they set out and encamped at the wadi Zered.

content: 13 From there they set out and encamped beyond the Arnon, that is, in the wilderness that extends from the territory of the Amorites. For the Arnon is the boundary of Moab, between Moab and the Amorites.
content_old: 13 From there they set out and encamped beyond the Arnon, that is, in the wilderness that extends from the territory of the Amorites. For the Arnon is the boundary of Moab, between Moab and the Amorites.

content: 14 Therefore the Book of the Wars of the LORD speaks of “… Waheb in Suphah, and the wadis: the Arnon
content_old: 14 Therefore the Book of the Wars of the LORD speaks of “… Waheb in Suphah, and the wadis: the Arnon

content: 15 with its tributary wadis, stretched along the settled country of Ar, hugging the territory of Moab …”
content_old: 15 with its tributary wadis, stretched along the settled country of Ar, hugging the territory of Moab …”

content: 16 And from there to Beer, which is the well where the LORD said to Moses, “Assemble the people that I may give them water.”
content_old: 16 And from there to Beer, which is the well where the LORD said to Moses, “Assemble the people that I may give them water.”

content: 17 Then Israel sang this song: Spring up, O well—sing to it—
content_old: 17 Then Israel sang this song: Spring up, O well—sing to it—

content: 18 The well which the chieftains dug, Which the nobles of the people started With maces, with their own staffs. And from Midbar to Mattanah,
