content_old: 19 and from Mattanah to Nahaliel, and from Nahaliel to Bamoth,

content: 20 and from Bamoth to the valley that is in the country of Moab, at the peak of Pisgah, overlooking the wasteland.
content_old: 20 and from Bamoth to the valley that is in the country of Moab, at the peak of Pisgah, overlooking the wasteland.

content: 21 Israel now sent messengers to Sihon king of the Amorites, saying,
content_old: 21 Israel now sent messengers to Sihon king of the Amorites, saying,

content: 22 “Let me pass through your country. We will not turn off into fields or vineyards, and we will not drink water from wells. We will follow the king’s highway until we have crossed your territory.”
content_old: 22 “Let me pass through your country. We will not turn off into fields or vineyards, and we will not drink water from wells. We will follow the king’s highway until we have crossed your territory.”

content: 23 But Sihon would not let Israel pass through his territory. Sihon gathered all his people and went out against Israel in the wilderness. He came to Jahaz and engaged Israel in battle.
content_old: 23 But Sihon would not let Israel pass through his territory. Sihon gathered all his people and went out against Israel in the wilderness. He came to Jahaz and engaged Israel in battle.

content: 24 But Israel put them to the sword, and took possession of their land, from the Arnon to the Jabbok, as far as of the Ammonites, for Az marked the boundary of the Ammonites.
content_old: 24 But Israel put them to the sword, and took possession of their land, from the Arnon to the Jabbok, as far as of the Ammonites, for Az marked the boundary of the Ammonites.

content: 25 Israel took all those towns. And Israel settled in all the towns of the Amorites, in Heshbon and all its dependencies.
content_old: 25 Israel took all those towns. And Israel settled in all the towns of the Amorites, in Heshbon and all its dependencies.

content: 26 Now Heshbon was the city of Sihon king of the Amorites, who had fought against a former king of Moab and taken all his land from him as far as the Arnon.
content_old: 26 Now Heshbon was the city of Sihon king of the Amorites, who had fought against a former king of Moab and taken all his land from him as far as the Arnon.

content: 27 Therefore the bards would recite: “Come to Heshbon; firmly built And well founded is Sihon’s city.
content_old: 27 Therefore the bards would recite: “Come to Heshbon; firmly built And well founded is Sihon’s city.

content: 28 For fire went forth from Heshbon, Flame from Sihon’s city, Consuming Ar of Moab, The lords of Bamoth by the Arnon.
content_old: 28 For fire went forth from Heshbon, Flame from Sihon’s city, Consuming Ar of Moab, The lords of Bamoth by the Arnon.

content: 29 Woe to you, O Moab! You are undone, O people of Chemosh! His sons are rendered fugitive And his daughters captive By an Amorite king, Sihon.”
content_old: 29 Woe to you, O Moab! You are undone, O people of Chemosh! His sons are rendered fugitive And his daughters captive By an Amorite king, Sihon.”

content: 30 Yet we have cast them down utterly, Heshbon along with Dibon; We have wrought desolation at Nophah, Which is hard by Medeba.
content_old: 30 Yet we have cast them down utterly, Heshbon along with Dibon; We have wrought desolation at Nophah, Which is hard by Medeba.

content: 31 So Israel occupied the land of the Amorites.
content_old: 31 So Israel occupied the land of the Amorites.

content: 32 Then Moses sent to spy out Jazer, and they captured its dependencies and dispossessed the Amorites who were there.
content_old: 32 Then Moses sent to spy out Jazer, and they captured its dependencies and dispossessed the Amorites who were there.

content: 33 They marched on and went up the road to Bashan, and King Og of Bashan, with all his people, came out to Edrei to engage them in battle.
content_old: 33 They marched on and went up the road to Bashan, and King Og of Bashan, with all his people, came out to Edrei to engage them in battle.

content: 34 But the LORD said to Moses, “Do not fear him, for I give him and all his people and his land into your hand. You shall do to him as you did to Sihon king of the Amorites who dwelt in Heshbon.”
content_old: 34 But the LORD said to Moses, “Do not fear him, for I give him and all his people and his land into your hand. You shall do to him as you did to Sihon king of the Amorites who dwelt in Heshbon.”

content: 1 The Israelites then marched on and encamped in the steppes of Moab, across the Jordan from Jericho.
content_old: 1 The Israelites then marched on and encamped in the steppes of Moab, across the Jordan from Jericho.

content: 2 Balak son of Zippor saw all that Israel had done to the Amorites.
content_old: 2 Balak son of Zippor saw all that Israel had done to the Amorites.

content: 3 Moab was alarmed because that people was so numerous. Moab dreaded the Israelites,
content_old: 3 Moab was alarmed because that people was so numerous. Moab dreaded the Israelites,

content: 4 and Moab said to the elders of Midian, “Now this horde will lick clean all that is about us as an ox licks up the grass of the field.” Balak son of Zippor, who was king of Moab at that time,
content_old: 4 and Moab said to the elders of Midian, “Now this horde will lick clean all that is about us as an ox licks up the grass of the field.” Balak son of Zippor, who was king of Moab at that time,

content: 5 sent messengers to Balaam son of Beor in Pethor, which is by the Euphrates, in the land of his kinsfolk, to invite him, saying, “There is a people that came out of Egypt; it hides the earth from view, and it is settled next to me.
content_old: 5 sent messengers to Balaam son of Beor in Pethor, which is by the Euphrates, in the land of his kinsfolk, to invite him, saying, “There is a people that came out of Egypt; it hides the earth from view, and it is settled next to me.

content: 6 Come then, put a curse upon this people for me, since they are too numerous for me; perhaps I can thus defeat them and drive them out of the land. For I know that he whom you bless is blessed indeed, and he whom you curse is cursed.”
content_old: 6 Come then, put a curse upon this people for me, since they are too numerous for me; perhaps I can thus defeat them and drive them out of the land. For I know that he whom you bless is blessed indeed, and he whom you curse is cursed.”

content: 7 The elders of Moab and the elders of Midian, versed in divination, set out. They came to Balaam and gave him Balak’s message.
content_old: 7 The elders of Moab and the elders of Midian, versed in divination, set out. They came to Balaam and gave him Balak’s message.

content: 8 He said to them, “Spend the night here, and I shall reply to you as the LORD may instruct me.” So the Moabite dignitaries stayed with Balaam.
content_old: 8 He said to them, “Spend the night here, and I shall reply to you as the LORD may instruct me.” So the Moabite dignitaries stayed with Balaam.

content: 9 God came to Balaam and said, “What do these people want of you?”
content_old: 9 God came to Balaam and said, “What do these people want of you?”

content: 10 Balaam said to God, “Balak son of Zippor, king of Moab, sent me this message:
content_old: 10 Balaam said to God, “Balak son of Zippor, king of Moab, sent me this message:

content: 11 Here is a people that came out from Egypt and hides the earth from view. Come now and curse them for me; perhaps I can engage them in battle and drive them off.”
content_old: 11 Here is a people that came out from Egypt and hides the earth from view. Come now and curse them for me; perhaps I can engage them in battle and drive them off.”

content: 12 But God said to Balaam, “Do not go with them. You must not curse that people, for they are blessed.”
content_old: 12 But God said to Balaam, “Do not go with them. You must not curse that people, for they are blessed.”

content: 13 Balaam arose in the morning and said to Balak’s dignitaries, “Go back to your own country, for the LORD will not let me go with you.”
content_old: 13 Balaam arose in the morning and said to Balak’s dignitaries, “Go back to your own country, for the LORD will not let me go with you.”

content: 14 The Moabite dignitaries left, and they came to Balak and said, “Balaam refused to come with us.”
content_old: 14 The Moabite dignitaries left, and they came to Balak and said, “Balaam refused to come with us.”

content: 15 Then Balak sent other dignitaries, more numerous and distinguished than the first.
content_old: 15 Then Balak sent other dignitaries, more numerous and distinguished than the first.

content: 16 They came to Balaam and said to him, “Thus says Balak son of Zippor: Please do not refuse to come to me.
content_old: 16 They came to Balaam and said to him, “Thus says Balak son of Zippor: Please do not refuse to come to me.

content: 17 I will reward you richly and I will do anything you ask of me. Only come and damn this people for me.”
content_old: 17 I will reward you richly and I will do anything you ask of me. Only come and damn this people for me.”

content: 18 Balaam replied to Balak’s officials, “Though Balak were to give me his house full of silver and gold, I could not do anything, big or little, contrary to the command of the LORD my God.
content_old: 18 Balaam replied to Balak’s officials, “Though Balak were to give me his house full of silver and gold, I could not do anything, big or little, contrary to the command of the LORD my God.

content: 19 So you, too, stay here overnight, and let me find out what else the LORD may say to me.”
content_old: 19 So you, too, stay here overnight, and let me find out what else the LORD may say to me.”

content: 20 That night God came to Balaam and said to him, “If these men have come to invite you, you may go with them. But whatever I command you, that you shall do.”
content_old: 20 That night God came to Balaam and said to him, “If these men have come to invite you, you may go with them. But whatever I command you, that you shall do.”

content: 21 When he arose in the morning, Balaam saddled his ass and departed with the Moabite dignitaries.
content_old: 21 When he arose in the morning, Balaam saddled his ass and departed with the Moabite dignitaries.

content: 22 But God was incensed at his going; so an angel of the LORD placed himself in his way as an adversary. He was riding on his she-ass, with his two servants alongside,
content_old: 22 But God was incensed at his going; so an angel of the LORD placed himself in his way as an adversary. He was riding on his she-ass, with his two servants alongside,

content: 23 when the ass caught sight of the angel of the LORD standing in the way, with his drawn sword in his hand. The ass swerved from the road and went into the fields; and Balaam beat the ass to turn her back onto the road.
content_old: 23 when the ass caught sight of the angel of the LORD standing in the way, with his drawn sword in his hand. The ass swerved from the road and went into the fields; and Balaam beat the ass to turn her back onto the road.

content: 24 The angel of the LORD then stationed himself in a lane between the vineyards, with a fence on either side.
content_old: 24 The angel of the LORD then stationed himself in a lane between the vineyards, with a fence on either side.

content: 25 The ass, seeing the angel of the LORD, pressed herself against the wall and squeezed Balaam’s foot against the wall; so he beat her again.
content_old: 25 The ass, seeing the angel of the LORD, pressed herself against the wall and squeezed Balaam’s foot against the wall; so he beat her again.

content: 26 Once more the angel of the LORD moved forward and stationed himself on a spot so narrow that there was no room to swerve right or left.
content_old: 26 Once more the angel of the LORD moved forward and stationed himself on a spot so narrow that there was no room to swerve right or left.

content: 27 When the ass now saw the angel of the LORD, she lay down under Balaam; and Balaam was furious and beat the ass with his stick.
content_old: 27 When the ass now saw the angel of the LORD, she lay down under Balaam; and Balaam was furious and beat the ass with his stick.

content: 28 Then the LORD opened the ass’s mouth, and she said to Balaam, “What have I done to you that you have beaten me these three times?”
content_old: 28 Then the LORD opened the ass’s mouth, and she said to Balaam, “What have I done to you that you have beaten me these three times?”

content: 29 Balaam said to the ass, “You have made a mockery of me! If I had a sword with me, I’d kill you.”
content_old: 29 Balaam said to the ass, “You have made a mockery of me! If I had a sword with me, I’d kill you.”

content: 30 The ass said to Balaam, “Look, I am the ass that you have been riding all along until this day! Have I been in the habit of doing thus to you?” And he answered, “No.”
content_old: 30 The ass said to Balaam, “Look, I am the ass that you have been riding all along until this day! Have I been in the habit of doing thus to you?” And he answered, “No.”

content: 31 Then the LORD uncovered Balaam’s eyes, and he saw the angel of the LORD standing in the way, his drawn sword in his hand; thereupon he bowed right down to the ground.
content_old: 31 Then the LORD uncovered Balaam’s eyes, and he saw the angel of the LORD standing in the way, his drawn sword in his hand; thereupon he bowed right down to the ground.

content: 32 The angel of the LORD said to him, “Why have you beaten your ass these three times? It is I who came out as an adversary, for the errand is obnoxious to me.
content_old: 32 The angel of the LORD said to him, “Why have you beaten your ass these three times? It is I who came out as an adversary, for the errand is obnoxious to me.

content: 33 And when the ass saw me, she shied away because of me those three times. If she had not shied away from me, you are the one I should have killed, while sparing her.”
content_old: 33 And when the ass saw me, she shied away because of me those three times. If she had not shied away from me, you are the one I should have killed, while sparing her.”

content: 34 Balaam said to the angel of the LORD, “I erred because I did not know that you were standing in my way. If you still disapprove, I will turn back.”
content_old: 34 Balaam said to the angel of the LORD, “I erred because I did not know that you were standing in my way. If you still disapprove, I will turn back.”

content: 35 But the angel of the LORD said to Balaam, “Go with the men. But you must say nothing except what I tell you.” So Balaam went on with Balak’s dignitaries.
content_old: 35 But the angel of the LORD said to Balaam, “Go with the men. But you must say nothing except what I tell you.” So Balaam went on with Balak’s dignitaries.

content: 36 When Balak heard that Balaam was coming, he went out to meet him at Ir-moab, which is on the Arnon border, at its farthest point.
content_old: 36 When Balak heard that Balaam was coming, he went out to meet him at Ir-moab, which is on the Arnon border, at its farthest point.

content: 37 Balak said to Balaam, “When I first sent to invite you, why didn’t you come to me? Am I really unable to reward you?”
content_old: 37 Balak said to Balaam, “When I first sent to invite you, why didn’t you come to me? Am I really unable to reward you?”

content: 38 But Balaam said to Balak, “And now that I have come to you, have I the power to speak freely? I can utter only the word that God puts into my mouth.”
content_old: 38 But Balaam said to Balak, “And now that I have come to you, have I the power to speak freely? I can utter only the word that God puts into my mouth.”

content: 39 Balaam went with Balak and they came to Kiriath-huzoth.
content_old: 39 Balaam went with Balak and they came to Kiriath-huzoth.

content: 40 Balak sacrificed oxen and sheep, and had them served to Balaam and the dignitaries with him.
content_old: 40 Balak sacrificed oxen and sheep, and had them served to Balaam and the dignitaries with him.

content: 1 Balaam said to Balak, “Build me seven altars here and have seven bulls and seven rams ready here for me.”
content_old: 1 Balaam said to Balak, “Build me seven altars here and have seven bulls and seven rams ready here for me.”

content: 2 Balak did as Balaam directed; and Balak and Balaam offered up a bull and a ram on each altar.
content_old: 2 Balak did as Balaam directed; and Balak and Balaam offered up a bull and a ram on each altar.

content: 3 Then Balaam said to Balak, “Stay here beside your offerings while I am gone. Perhaps the LORD will grant me a manifestation, and whatever He reveals to me I will tell you.” And he went off alone.
content_old: 3 Then Balaam said to Balak, “Stay here beside your offerings while I am gone. Perhaps the LORD will grant me a manifestation, and whatever He reveals to me I will tell you.” And he went off alone.

content: 4 God manifested Himself to Balaam, who said to Him, “I have set up the seven altars and offered up a bull and a ram on each altar.”
content_old: 4 God manifested Himself to Balaam, who said to Him, “I have set up the seven altars and offered up a bull and a ram on each altar.”

content: 5 And the LORD put a word in Balaam’s mouth and said, “Return to Balak and speak thus.”
content_old: 5 And the LORD put a word in Balaam’s mouth and said, “Return to Balak and speak thus.”

content: 6 So he returned to him and found him standing beside his offerings, and all the Moabite dignitaries with him.
content_old: 6 So he returned to him and found him standing beside his offerings, and all the Moabite dignitaries with him.

content: 7 He took up his theme, and said: From Aram has Balak brought me, Moab’s king from the hills of the East: Come, curse me Jacob, Come, tell Israel’s doom!
content_old: 7 He took up his theme, and said: From Aram has Balak brought me, Moab’s king from the hills of the East: Come, curse me Jacob, Come, tell Israel’s doom!

content: 8 How can I damn whom God has not damned, How doom when the LORD has not doomed?
content_old: 8 How can I damn whom God has not damned, How doom when the LORD has not doomed?

content: 9 As I see them from the mountain tops, Gaze on them from the heights, There is a people that dwells apart, Not reckoned among the nations,
content_old: 9 As I see them from the mountain tops, Gaze on them from the heights, There is a people that dwells apart, Not reckoned among the nations,

content: 10 Who can count the dust of Jacob, Number the dust-cloud of Israel? May I die the death of the upright, May my fate be like theirs!
content_old: 10 Who can count the dust of Jacob, Number the dust-cloud of Israel? May I die the death of the upright, May my fate be like theirs!

content: 11 Then Balak said to Balaam, “What have you done to me? Here I brought you to damn my enemies, and instead you have blessed them!”
content_old: 11 Then Balak said to Balaam, “What have you done to me? Here I brought you to damn my enemies, and instead you have blessed them!”

content: 12 He replied, “I can only repeat faithfully what the LORD puts in my mouth.”
content_old: 12 He replied, “I can only repeat faithfully what the LORD puts in my mouth.”

content: 13 Then Balak said to him, “Come with me to another place from which you can see them—you will see only a portion of them; you will not see all of them—and damn them for me from there.”
content_old: 13 Then Balak said to him, “Come with me to another place from which you can see them—you will see only a portion of them; you will not see all of them—and damn them for me from there.”

content: 14 With that, he took him to Sedehzophim, on the summit of Pisgah. He built seven altars and offered a bull and a ram on each altar.
content_old: 14 With that, he took him to Sedehzophim, on the summit of Pisgah. He built seven altars and offered a bull and a ram on each altar.

content: 15 And Balaam said to Balak, “Stay here beside your offerings, while I seek a manifestation yonder.”
content_old: 15 And Balaam said to Balak, “Stay here beside your offerings, while I seek a manifestation yonder.”

content: 16 The LORD manifested Himself to Balaam and put a word in his mouth, saying, “Return to Balak and speak thus.”
content_old: 16 The LORD manifested Himself to Balaam and put a word in his mouth, saying, “Return to Balak and speak thus.”

content: 17 He went to him and found him standing beside his offerings, and the Moabite dignitaries with him. Balak asked him, “What did the LORD say?”
content_old: 17 He went to him and found him standing beside his offerings, and the Moabite dignitaries with him. Balak asked him, “What did the LORD say?”

content: 18 And he took up his theme, and said: Up, Balak, attend, Give ear unto me, son of Zippor!
content_old: 18 And he took up his theme, and said: Up, Balak, attend, Give ear unto me, son of Zippor!

content: 19 God is not man to be capricious, Or mortal to change His mind. Would He speak and not act, Promise and not fulfill?
content_old: 19 God is not man to be capricious, Or mortal to change His mind. Would He speak and not act, Promise and not fulfill?

content: 20 My message was to bless: When He blesses, I cannot reverse it.
content_old: 20 My message was to bless: When He blesses, I cannot reverse it.

content: 21 No harm is in sight for Jacob, No woe in view for Israel. The LORD their God is with them, And their King’s acclaim in their midst.
content_old: 21 No harm is in sight for Jacob, No woe in view for Israel. The LORD their God is with them, And their King’s acclaim in their midst.

content: 22 God who freed them from Egypt Is for them like the horns of the wild ox.
content_old: 22 God who freed them from Egypt Is for them like the horns of the wild ox.

content: 23 Lo, there is no augury in Jacob, No divining in Israel: Jacob is told at once, Yea Israel, what God has planned.
content_old: 23 Lo, there is no augury in Jacob, No divining in Israel: Jacob is told at once, Yea Israel, what God has planned.

content: 24 Lo, a people that rises like a lion, Leaps up like the king of beasts, Rests not till it has feasted on prey And drunk the blood of the slain.
content_old: 24 Lo, a people that rises like a lion, Leaps up like the king of beasts, Rests not till it has feasted on prey And drunk the blood of the slain.

content: 25 Thereupon Balak said to Balaam, “Don’t curse them and don’t bless them!”
content_old: 25 Thereupon Balak said to Balaam, “Don’t curse them and don’t bless them!”

content: 26 In reply, Balaam said to Balak, “But I told you: Whatever the LORD says, that I must do.”
content_old: 26 In reply, Balaam said to Balak, “But I told you: Whatever the LORD says, that I must do.”

content: 27 Then Balak said to Balaam, “Come now, I will take you to another place. Perhaps God will deem it right that you damn them for me there.”
content_old: 27 Then Balak said to Balaam, “Come now, I will take you to another place. Perhaps God will deem it right that you damn them for me there.”

content: 28 Balak took Balaam to the peak of Peor, which overlooks the wasteland.
content_old: 28 Balak took Balaam to the peak of Peor, which overlooks the wasteland.

content: 29 Balaam said to Balak, “Build me here seven altars, and have seven bulls and seven rams ready for me here.”
content_old: 29 Balaam said to Balak, “Build me here seven altars, and have seven bulls and seven rams ready for me here.”

content: 1 Now Balaam, seeing that it pleased the LORD to bless Israel, did not, as on previous occasions, go in search of omens, but turned his face toward the wilderness.
content_old: 1 Now Balaam, seeing that it pleased the LORD to bless Israel, did not, as on previous occasions, go in search of omens, but turned his face toward the wilderness.

content: 2 As Balaam looked up and saw Israel encamped tribe by tribe, the spirit of God came upon him.
content_old: 2 As Balaam looked up and saw Israel encamped tribe by tribe, the spirit of God came upon him.

content: 3 Taking up his theme, he said: Word of Balaam son of Beor, Word of the man whose eye is true,
content_old: 3 Taking up his theme, he said: Word of Balaam son of Beor, Word of the man whose eye is true,

content: 4 Word of him who hears God’s speech, Who beholds visions from the Almighty, Prostrate, but with eyes unveiled:
content_old: 4 Word of him who hears God’s speech, Who beholds visions from the Almighty, Prostrate, but with eyes unveiled:

content: 5 How fair are your tents, O Jacob, Your dwellings, O Israel!
content_old: 5 How fair are your tents, O Jacob, Your dwellings, O Israel!

content: 6 Like palm-groves that stretch out, Like gardens beside a river, Like aloes planted by the LORD, Like cedars beside the water;
content_old: 6 Like palm-groves that stretch out, Like gardens beside a river, Like aloes planted by the LORD, Like cedars beside the water;

content: 7 Their boughs drip with moisture, Their roots have abundant water. Their king shall rise above Agag, Their kingdom shall be exalted.
content_old: 7 Their boughs drip with moisture, Their roots have abundant water. Their king shall rise above Agag, Their kingdom shall be exalted.

content: 8 God who freed them from Egypt Is for them like the horns of the wild ox. They shall devour enemy nations, Crush their bones, And smash their arrows.
content_old: 8 God who freed them from Egypt Is for them like the horns of the wild ox. They shall devour enemy nations, Crush their bones, And smash their arrows.

content: 9 They crouch, they lie down like a lion, Like the king of beasts; who dare rouse them? Blessed are they who bless you, Accursed they who curse you!
content_old: 9 They crouch, they lie down like a lion, Like the king of beasts; who dare rouse them? Blessed are they who bless you, Accursed they who curse you!

content: 10 Enraged at Balaam, Balak struck his hands together. “I called you,” Balak said to Balaam, “to damn my enemies, and instead you have blessed them these three times!
content_old: 10 Enraged at Balaam, Balak struck his hands together. “I called you,” Balak said to Balaam, “to damn my enemies, and instead you have blessed them these three times!

content: 11 Back with you at once to your own place! I was going to reward you richly, but the LORD has denied you the reward.”
content_old: 11 Back with you at once to your own place! I was going to reward you richly, but the LORD has denied you the reward.”

content: 12 Balaam replied to Balak, “But I even told the messengers you sent to me,
content_old: 12 Balaam replied to Balak, “But I even told the messengers you sent to me,

content: 13 ‘Though Balak were to give me his house full of silver and gold, I could not of my own accord do anything good or bad contrary to the LORD’s command. What the LORD says, that I must say.’
content_old: 13 ‘Though Balak were to give me his house full of silver and gold, I could not of my own accord do anything good or bad contrary to the LORD’s command. What the LORD says, that I must say.’

content: 14 And now, as I go back to my people, let me inform you of what this people will do to your people in days to come.”
content_old: 14 And now, as I go back to my people, let me inform you of what this people will do to your people in days to come.”

content: 15 He took up his theme, and said: Word of Balaam son of Beor, Word of the man whose eye is true,
content_old: 15 He took up his theme, and said: Word of Balaam son of Beor, Word of the man whose eye is true,

content: 16 Word of him who hears God’s speech, Who obtains knowledge from the Most High, And beholds visions from the Almighty, Prostrate, but with eyes unveiled:
content_old: 16 Word of him who hears God’s speech, Who obtains knowledge from the Most High, And beholds visions from the Almighty, Prostrate, but with eyes unveiled:

content: 17 What I see for them is not yet, What I behold will not be soon: A star rises from Jacob, A scepter comes forth from Israel; It smashes the brow of Moab, The foundation of all children of Seth.
content_old: 17 What I see for them is not yet, What I behold will not be soon: A star rises from Jacob, A scepter comes forth from Israel; It smashes the brow of Moab, The foundation of all children of Seth.

content: 18 Edom becomes a possession, Yea, Seir a possession of its enemies; But Israel is triumphant.
content_old: 18 Edom becomes a possession, Yea, Seir a possession of its enemies; But Israel is triumphant.

content: 19 A victor issues from Jacob To wipe out what is left of Ir.
content_old: 19 A victor issues from Jacob To wipe out what is left of Ir.

content: 20 He saw Amalek and, taking up his theme, he said: A leading nation is Amalek; But its fate is to perish forever.
content_old: 20 He saw Amalek and, taking up his theme, he said: A leading nation is Amalek; But its fate is to perish forever.

content: 21 He saw the Kenites and, taking up his theme, he said: Though your abode be secure, And your nest be set among cliffs,
content_old: 21 He saw the Kenites and, taking up his theme, he said: Though your abode be secure, And your nest be set among cliffs,

content: 22 Yet shall Kain be consumed, When Asshur takes you captive.
content_old: 22 Yet shall Kain be consumed, When Asshur takes you captive.

content: 23 He took up his theme and said: Alas, who can survive except God has willed it!
content_old: 23 He took up his theme and said: Alas, who can survive except God has willed it!

content: 24 Ships come from the quarter of Kittim; They subject Asshur, subject Eber. They, too, shall perish forever.
content_old: 24 Ships come from the quarter of Kittim; They subject Asshur, subject Eber. They, too, shall perish forever.

content: 1 While Israel was staying at Shittim, the people profaned themselves by whoring with the Moabite women,

content: 3 Thus Israel attached itself to Baal-peor, and the LORD was incensed with Israel.

content: 4 The LORD said to Moses, “Take all the ringleaders and have them publicly impaled before the LORD, so that the LORD’s wrath may turn away from Israel.”
content_old: 4 The LORD said to Moses, “Take all the ringleaders and have them publicly impaled before the LORD, so that the LORD’s wrath may turn away from Israel.”

content: 5 So Moses said to Israel’s officials, “Each of you slay those of his men who attached themselves to Baal-peor.”

content: 6 Just then one of the Israelites came and brought a Midianite woman over to his companions, in the sight of Moses and of the whole Israelite community who were weeping at the entrance of the Tent of Meeting.

content: 7 When Phinehas, son of Eleazar son of Aaron the priest, saw this, he left the assembly and, taking a spear in his hand,

content: 8 he followed the Israelite into the chamber and stabbed both of them, the Israelite and the woman, through the belly. Then the plague against the Israelites was checked.
content_old: 8 he followed the Israelite into the chamber and stabbed both of them, the Israelite and the woman, through the belly. Then the plague against the Israelites was checked.

content: 9 Those who died of the plague numbered twenty-four thousand.

content: 10 The LORD spoke to Moses, saying,
content_old: 10 The LORD spoke to Moses, saying,

content: 11 “Phinehas, son of Eleazar son of Aaron the priest, has turned back My wrath from the Israelites by displaying among them his passion for Me, so that I did not wipe out the Israelite people in My passion.
content_old: 11 “Phinehas, son of Eleazar son of Aaron the priest, has turned back My wrath from the Israelites by displaying among them his passion for Me, so that I did not wipe out the Israelite people in My passion.

content: 12 Say, therefore, ‘I grant him My pact of friendship.

content: 13 It shall be for him and his descendants after him a pact of priesthood for all time, because he took impassioned action for his God, thus making expiation for the Israelites.’ ”
content_old: 13 It shall be for him and his descendants after him a pact of priesthood for all time, because he took impassioned action for his God, thus making expiation for the Israelites.’ ”

content: 52 The LORD spoke to Moses, saying,
content_old: 52 The LORD spoke to Moses, saying,

content: 53 “Among these shall the land be apportioned as shares, according to the listed names:
content_old: 53 “Among these shall the land be apportioned as shares, according to the listed names:

content: 54 with larger groups increase the share, with smaller groups reduce the share. Each is to be assigned its share according to its enrollment.
content_old: 54 with larger groups increase the share, with smaller groups reduce the share. Each is to be assigned its share according to its enrollment.

content: 55 The land, moreover, is to be apportioned by lot; and the allotment shall be made according to the listings of their ancestral tribes.
content_old: 55 The land, moreover, is to be apportioned by lot; and the allotment shall be made according to the listings of their ancestral tribes.

content: 56 Each portion shall be assigned by lot, whether for larger or smaller groups.”
content_old: 56 Each portion shall be assigned by lot, whether for larger or smaller groups.”

content: 57 This is the enrollment of the Levites by their clans: Of Gershon, the clan of the Gershonites; of Kohath, the clan of the Kohathites; of Merari, the clan of the Merarites.
content_old: 57 This is the enrollment of the Levites by their clans: Of Gershon, the clan of the Gershonites; of Kohath, the clan of the Kohathites; of Merari, the clan of the Merarites.

content: 58 These are the clans of Levi: The clan of the Libnites, the clan of the Hebronites, the clan of the Mahlites, the clan of the Mushites, the clan of the Korahites.—Kohath begot Amram.
content_old: 58 These are the clans of Levi: The clan of the Libnites, the clan of the Hebronites, the clan of the Mahlites, the clan of the Mushites, the clan of the Korahites.—Kohath begot Amram.

content: 59 The name of Amram’s wife was Jochebed daughter of Levi, who was born to Levi in Egypt; she bore to Amram Aaron and Moses and their sister Miriam.
content_old: 59 The name of Amram’s wife was Jochebed daughter of Levi, who was born to Levi in Egypt; she bore to Amram Aaron and Moses and their sister Miriam.

content: 60 To Aaron were born Nadab and Abihu, Eleazar and Ithamar.
content_old: 60 To Aaron were born Nadab and Abihu, Eleazar and Ithamar.

content: 61 Nadab and Abihu died when they offered alien fire before the LORD.—
content_old: 61 Nadab and Abihu died when they offered alien fire before the LORD.—

content: 62 Their enrollment of 23,000 comprised all males from a month up. They were not part of the regular enrollment of the Israelites, since no share was assigned to them among the Israelites.
content_old: 62 Their enrollment of 23,000 comprised all males from a month up. They were not part of the regular enrollment of the Israelites, since no share was assigned to them among the Israelites.

content: 63 These are the persons enrolled by Moses and Eleazar the priest who registered the Israelites on the steppes of Moab, at the Jordan near Jericho.

content: 64 Among these there was not one of those enrolled by Moses and Aaron the priest when they recorded the Israelites in the wilderness of Sinai.

content: 1 The daughters of Zelophehad, of Manassite family—son of Hepher son of Gilead son of Machir son of Manasseh son of Joseph—came forward. The names of the daughters were Mahlah, Noah, Hoglah, Milcah, and Tirzah.
content_old: 1 The daughters of Zelophehad, of Manassite family—son of Hepher son of Gilead son of Machir son of Manasseh son of Joseph—came forward. The names of the daughters were Mahlah, Noah, Hoglah, Milcah, and Tirzah.

content: 2 They stood before Moses, Eleazar the priest, the chieftains, and the whole assembly, at the entrance of the Tent of Meeting, and they said,
content_old: 2 They stood before Moses, Eleazar the priest, the chieftains, and the whole assembly, at the entrance of the Tent of Meeting, and they said,

content: 3 “Our father died in the wilderness. He was not one of the faction, Korah’s faction, which banded together against the LORD, but died for his own sin; and he has left no sons.
content_old: 3 “Our father died in the wilderness. He was not one of the faction, Korah’s faction, which banded together against the LORD, but died for his own sin; and he has left no sons.

content: 4 Let not our father’s name be lost to his clan just because he had no son! Give us a holding among our father’s kinsmen!”
content_old: 4 Let not our father’s name be lost to his clan just because he had no son! Give us a holding among our father’s kinsmen!”

content: 5 Moses brought their case before the LORD.
content_old: 5 Moses brought their case before the LORD.

content: 6 And the LORD said to Moses,
content_old: 6 And the LORD said to Moses,

content: 7 “The plea of Zelophehad’s daughters is just: you should give them a hereditary holding among their father’s kinsmen; transfer their father’s share to them.
content_old: 7 “The plea of Zelophehad’s daughters is just: you should give them a hereditary holding among their father’s kinsmen; transfer their father’s share to them.

content: 8 “Further, speak to the Israelite people as follows: ‘If a man dies without leaving a son, you shall transfer his property to his daughter.
content_old: 8 “Further, speak to the Israelite people as follows: ‘If a man dies without leaving a son, you shall transfer his property to his daughter.

content: 9 If he has no daughter, you shall assign his property to his brothers.
content_old: 9 If he has no daughter, you shall assign his property to his brothers.

content: 10 If he has no brothers, you shall assign his property to his father’s brothers.
content_old: 10 If he has no brothers, you shall assign his property to his father’s brothers.

content: 11 If his father had no brothers, you shall assign his property to his nearest relative in his own clan, and he shall inherit it.’ This shall be the law of procedure for the Israelites, in accordance with the LORD’s command to Moses.”
content_old: 11 If his father had no brothers, you shall assign his property to his nearest relative in his own clan, and he shall inherit it.’ This shall be the law of procedure for the Israelites, in accordance with the LORD’s command to Moses.”

content: 12 The LORD said to Moses, “Ascend these heights of Abarim and view the land that I have given to the Israelite people.
content_old: 12 The LORD said to Moses, “Ascend these heights of Abarim and view the land that I have given to the Israelite people.

content: 13 When you have seen it, you too shall be gathered to your kin, just as your brother Aaron was.
content_old: 13 When you have seen it, you too shall be gathered to your kin, just as your brother Aaron was.

content: 14 For, in the wilderness of Zin, when the community was contentious, you disobeyed My command to uphold My sanctity in their sight by means of the water.” Those are the Waters of Meribath-kadesh, in the wilderness of Zin.
content_old: 14 For, in the wilderness of Zin, when the community was contentious, you disobeyed My command to uphold My sanctity in their sight by means of the water.” Those are the Waters of Meribath-kadesh, in the wilderness of Zin.

content: 15 Moses spoke to the LORD, saying,
content_old: 15 Moses spoke to the LORD, saying,

content: 16 “Let the LORD, Source of the breath of all flesh, appoint someone over the community
content_old: 16 “Let the LORD, Source of the breath of all flesh, appoint someone over the community

content: 17 who shall go out before them and come in before them, and who shall take them out and bring them in, so that the LORD’s community may not be like sheep that have no shepherd.”
content_old: 17 who shall go out before them and come in before them, and who shall take them out and bring them in, so that the LORD’s community may not be like sheep that have no shepherd.”

content: 18 And the LORD answered Moses, “Single out Joshua son of Nun, an inspired man, and lay your hand upon him.
content_old: 18 And the LORD answered Moses, “Single out Joshua son of Nun, an inspired man, and lay your hand upon him.

content: 19 Have him stand before Eleazar the priest and before the whole community, and commission him in their sight.
content_old: 19 Have him stand before Eleazar the priest and before the whole community, and commission him in their sight.

content: 20 Invest him with some of your authority, so that the whole Israelite community may obey.
content_old: 20 Invest him with some of your authority, so that the whole Israelite community may obey.

content: 21 But he shall present himself to Eleazar the priest, who shall on his behalf seek the decision of the Urim before the LORD. By such instruction they shall go out and by such instruction they shall come in, he and all the Israelites, the whole community.”
content_old: 21 But he shall present himself to Eleazar the priest, who shall on his behalf seek the decision of the Urim before the LORD. By such instruction they shall go out and by such instruction they shall come in, he and all the Israelites, the whole community.”

content: 22 Moses did as the LORD commanded him. He took Joshua and had him stand before Eleazar the priest and before the whole community.
content_old: 22 Moses did as the LORD commanded him. He took Joshua and had him stand before Eleazar the priest and before the whole community.

content: 1 The LORD spoke to Moses, saying:
content_old: 1 The LORD spoke to Moses, saying:

content: 2 Command the Israelite people and say to them: Be punctilious in presenting to Me at stated times the offerings of food due Me, as offerings by fire of pleasing odor to Me.
content_old: 2 Command the Israelite people and say to them: Be punctilious in presenting to Me at stated times the offerings of food due Me, as offerings by fire of pleasing odor to Me.

content: 3 Say to them: These are the offerings by fire that you are to present to the LORD: As a regular burnt offering every day, two yearling lambs without blemish.
content_old: 3 Say to them: These are the offerings by fire that you are to present to the LORD: As a regular burnt offering every day, two yearling lambs without blemish.

content: 4 You shall offer one lamb in the morning, and the other lamb you shall offer at twilight.
content_old: 4 You shall offer one lamb in the morning, and the other lamb you shall offer at twilight.

content: 5 And as a meal offering, there shall be a tenth of an ephah of choice flour with a quarter of a hin of beaten oil mixed in
content_old: 5 And as a meal offering, there shall be a tenth of an ephah of choice flour with a quarter of a hin of beaten oil mixed in

content: 6 —the regular burnt offering instituted at Mount Sinai—an offering by fire of pleasing odor to the LORD.
content_old: 6 —the regular burnt offering instituted at Mount Sinai—an offering by fire of pleasing odor to the LORD.

content: 7 The libation with it shall be a quarter of a hin for each lamb, to be poured in the sacred precinct as an offering of fermented drink to the LORD.
content_old: 7 The libation with it shall be a quarter of a hin for each lamb, to be poured in the sacred precinct as an offering of fermented drink to the LORD.

content: 8 The other lamb you shall offer at twilight, preparing the same meal offering and libation as in the morning—an offering by fire of pleasing odor to the LORD.
content_old: 8 The other lamb you shall offer at twilight, preparing the same meal offering and libation as in the morning—an offering by fire of pleasing odor to the LORD.

content: 9 On the sabbath day: two yearling lambs without blemish, together with two-tenths of a measure of choice flour with oil mixed in as a meal offering, and with the proper libation—
content_old: 9 On the sabbath day: two yearling lambs without blemish, together with two-tenths of a measure of choice flour with oil mixed in as a meal offering, and with the proper libation—

content: 10 a burnt offering for every sabbath, in addition to the regular burnt offering and its libation.
content_old: 10 a burnt offering for every sabbath, in addition to the regular burnt offering and its libation.

content: 11 On your new moons you shall present a burnt offering to the LORD: two bulls of the herd, one ram, and seven yearling lambs, without blemish.
content_old: 11 On your new moons you shall present a burnt offering to the LORD: two bulls of the herd, one ram, and seven yearling lambs, without blemish.

content: 12 As meal offering for each bull: three-tenths of a measure of choice flour with oil mixed in. As meal offering for each ram: two-tenths of a measure of choice flour with oil mixed in.
content_old: 12 As meal offering for each bull: three-tenths of a measure of choice flour with oil mixed in. As meal offering for each ram: two-tenths of a measure of choice flour with oil mixed in.

content: 13 As meal offering for each lamb: a tenth of a measure of fine flour with oil mixed in. Such shall be the burnt offering of pleasing odor, an offering by fire to the LORD.
content_old: 13 As meal offering for each lamb: a tenth of a measure of fine flour with oil mixed in. Such shall be the burnt offering of pleasing odor, an offering by fire to the LORD.

content: 14 Their libations shall be: half a hin of wine for a bull, a third of a hin for a ram, and a quarter of a hin for a lamb. That shall be the monthly burnt offering for each new moon of the year.
content_old: 14 Their libations shall be: half a hin of wine for a bull, a third of a hin for a ram, and a quarter of a hin for a lamb. That shall be the monthly burnt offering for each new moon of the year.

content: 15 And there shall be one goat as a sin offering to the LORD, to be offered in addition to the regular burnt offering and its libation.
content_old: 15 And there shall be one goat as a sin offering to the LORD, to be offered in addition to the regular burnt offering and its libation.

content: 16 In the first month, on the fourteenth day of the month, there shall be a passover sacrifice to the LORD,
content_old: 16 In the first month, on the fourteenth day of the month, there shall be a passover sacrifice to the LORD,

content: 17 and on the fifteenth day of that month a festival. Unleavened bread shall be eaten for seven days.
content_old: 17 and on the fifteenth day of that month a festival. Unleavened bread shall be eaten for seven days.

content: 18 The first day shall be a sacred occasion: you shall not work at your occupations.
content_old: 18 The first day shall be a sacred occasion: you shall not work at your occupations.

content: 19 You shall present an offering by fire, a burnt offering, to the LORD: two bulls of the herd, one ram, and seven yearling lambs—see that they are without blemish.
content_old: 19 You shall present an offering by fire, a burnt offering, to the LORD: two bulls of the herd, one ram, and seven yearling lambs—see that they are without blemish.

content: 20 The meal offering with them shall be of choice flour with oil mixed in: prepare three-tenths of a measure for a bull, two-tenths for a ram;
content_old: 20 The meal offering with them shall be of choice flour with oil mixed in: prepare three-tenths of a measure for a bull, two-tenths for a ram;

content: 21 and for each of the seven lambs prepare one-tenth of a measure.
content_old: 21 and for each of the seven lambs prepare one-tenth of a measure.

content: 22 And there shall be one goat for a sin offering, to make expiation in your behalf.
content_old: 22 And there shall be one goat for a sin offering, to make expiation in your behalf.

content: 23 You shall present these in addition to the morning portion of the regular burnt offering.
content_old: 23 You shall present these in addition to the morning portion of the regular burnt offering.

content: 24 You shall offer the like daily for seven days as food, an offering by fire of pleasing odor to the LORD; they shall be offered, with their libations, in addition to the regular burnt offering.
content_old: 24 You shall offer the like daily for seven days as food, an offering by fire of pleasing odor to the LORD; they shall be offered, with their libations, in addition to the regular burnt offering.

content: 25 And the seventh day shall be a sacred occasion for you: you shall not work at your occupations.
content_old: 25 And the seventh day shall be a sacred occasion for you: you shall not work at your occupations.

content: 26 On the day of the first fruits, your Feast of Weeks, when you bring an offering of new grain to the LORD, you shall observe a sacred occasion: you shall not work at your occupations.

content: 27 You shall present a burnt offering of pleasing odor to the LORD: two bulls of the herd, one ram, seven yearling lambs.
content_old: 27 You shall present a burnt offering of pleasing odor to the LORD: two bulls of the herd, one ram, seven yearling lambs.

content: 28 The meal offering with them shall be of choice flour with oil mixed in, three-tenths of a measure for a bull, two-tenths for a ram,

content: 29 and one-tenth for each of the seven lambs.
